     286             : Truncate the integer result_value and store it in *result.  result->type
     287             : indicates the desired result type.  If check_overflow is TRUE and
     288             : *err_code indicates no previous error, check that the value fits in
     289             : the result type; if it does not, set *err_code and *err_severity to
     290             : indicate the error.  Whether or not the check is done, and whether or
     291             : not it succeeds, the value will be adjusted if necessary to ensure

     434             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
     435           0 :     default:
     436           0 :       unexpected_condition();
     437             :   }  /* switch */
     438        6166 :   new_constant->variant.integer_value = old_constant->variant.integer_value;
     439             :   /* Determine attributes (size, signedness) of the new integer kind. */
     440        6166 :   get_integer_attributes(new_constant, &new_ikind, &new_signed, &new_bit_size);
     441             :   /* Truncate the new value to the right size. */
     442             :   /* Note that the mask created here is used again later in this routine. */
     443        6166 :   make_integer_value_mask(&mask, new_bit_size);
     444        6166 :   and_integer_values(&new_constant->variant.integer_value, &mask);
     445             :   /* Sign-extend the new value if necessary. */
     446        6166 :   if (new_signed) {
     447        3073 :     sign_extend_integer_value(&new_constant->variant.integer_value,
     448        6166 :                               new_bit_size);

     451             :     /* If the value changed, a warning is in order. */
     452        5012 :     if (cmp_integer_constants(new_constant, old_constant) != 0 &&

     454             :            implicitly convert a pointer to an integer type, so the old
     455             :            constant could be something like (void *)1.  Avoid the
     456             :            checking in such cases. */

     459             :          is a truncation (dropping bits) or a sign change. */
     460           0 :       is_sign_change = FALSE;

     464             :         /* The new size is at least as big as the old size, so no truncation
     465             :            is possible.  Therefore, this must be a sign change. */
     466             :         is_sign_change = TRUE;
     467             :       } else {
     468             :         /* The new size is smaller than the old size, which means truncation
     469             :            is possible.  See if the significant part of the new value is the
     470             :            same as the old value.  If so, no bits have been lost, and
     471             :            this is a sign change. */
     472           0 :         old_value_copy = old_constant->variant.integer_value;
     473           0 :         if (old_signed && sign_of_integer_constant(old_constant) < 0) {
     474             :           /* Old constant is negative.  Turn on all the bits of the copy of
     475             :              the old constant down to where the sign bit is (or would be) in
     476             :              the new size.  If that gives a value that is equal to the
     477             :              old constant, then no information was lost, i.e., there is
     478             :              no interesting information -- just sign extension -- in the
     479             :              bits that don't fit into the new size. */

     481           0 :           complement_integer_value(&mask);

     485             :              bits of the old constant that do not fit in the new size.

     487             :              then no information was lost. */
     488             :           /* make_integer_value_mask(&mask, new_bit_size); -- already set. */

     524         158 : static void conv_integer_to_float(a_constant        *old_constant,
     525             :                                   a_constant        *new_constant,

     593           0 : a_boolean conv_float_value_to_int_value(

     860             :         }
     861           0 :         break;

     865             :     }  /* switch */
     866             :   } else
     867             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
     868             :   {
     869             :     /* Singular floating-point types in the same domain (i.e., two real or
     870             :        imaginary constants). */

     891          11 : static void get_pointer_offset(a_constant_ptr constant,

     943           0 : static char *base_object(a_constant  *constant,
     944             :                          a_boolean   *unknown)

    1029             : 
    1030           9 : void fold_base_class_cast(a_constant        *constant_1,
    1031             :                           a_base_class      *bcp,
    1032             :                           a_type_ptr        qualifiers_model,
    1033             :                           a_constant        *result,
    1034             :                           a_boolean         check_cast_access,
    1035             :                           a_boolean         check_ambiguity,
    1036             :                           a_boolean         is_implicit_cast,
    1037             :                           a_boolean         is_object_pointer,
    1038             :                           a_boolean         omit_backing_expr,
    1039             :                           a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    1040             :                           a_source_position *err_pos,
    1041             :                           an_error_code     *error_detected)
    1042             : /*
    1043             : Fold a C++ cast of a class pointer to a base class pointer.  constant_1 is
    1044             : an address of a class object or an error constant.  In the former case, it
    1045             : is converted to a pointer to the base class indicated by bcp and the new
    1046             : constant is returned in *result.  qualifiers_model is a class type whose
    1047             : cv-qualification indicates the cv-qualification desired on the result
    1048             : (i.e., the result type is the base class type of bcp and the cv-qualifiers
    1049             : of qualifiers_model).  result->type need not be set on entry.  Do access
    1050             : control on the cast if check_cast_access is TRUE.  Check for ambiguity on the
    1051             : cast if check_ambiguity is TRUE.  The cast is implicit if is_implicit_cast is
    1052             : TRUE.  The pointer is known to point to an object if is_object_pointer is TRUE.
    1053             : If omit_backing_expr is TRUE, do not record a backing expression.  If the
    1054             : operation cannot be folded, *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.  If there is an
    1055             : error, issue it at *err_pos.  If error_detected is non-NULL, set
    1056             : *error_detected to the code for any error detected, and do not issue the
    1057             : diagnostic, or set it to ec_no_error if there was no error.  An error constant
    1058             : is (successfully) folded to another error constant.
    1059             : */
    1060             : {
    1061           9 :   a_boolean             err;
    1062           9 :   a_type_ptr            orig_type, curr_type, new_type;
    1063           9 :   a_derivation_step_ptr dsp;
    1064           9 :   an_integer_value      base_class_offset;
    1065           9 :   a_base_class_ptr      base_class;
    1066             : 
    1067           9 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    1068           9 :   if (error_detected != NULL) *error_detected = ec_no_error;
    1069             :   /* The code here looks like add_base_class_casts. */
    1070           9 :   if (bcp->ambiguous && check_ambiguity) {
    1071             :     /* The base class is ambiguous. */
    1072           0 :     if (error_detected != NULL) {
    1073           0 :       *error_detected = ec_ambiguous_base_class;
    1074             :     } else {
    1075           0 :       pos_ty_error(ec_ambiguous_base_class, err_pos, bcp->type);
    1076             :     }  /* if */
    1077           0 :     set_error_constant(result);
    1078           9 :   } else if (bcp->derivation == NULL) {
    1079             :     /* Do not fold in the case of a dummy base class invented for a projection
    1080             :        of a member of a nonreal class into another class, e.g., via a
    1081             :        using-declaration. */
    1082           0 :     *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    1083           9 :   } else if (constant_1->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param) {
    1084             :     /* Can't fold a dependent case. */
    1085           0 :     *did_not_fold = TRUE;

    1094           9 :     copy_constant(constant_1, result);

    1216           0 : static void fold_derived_class_cast(a_constant        *constant_1,
    1217             :                                     a_base_class      *bcp,
    1218             :                                     a_constant        *result,
    1219             :                                     a_source_position *err_pos,
    1220             :                                     an_error_code     *error_detected)
    1221             : /*
    1222             : Fold a C++ cast of a class pointer to a derived class pointer.  constant_1 is
    1223             : an address of a class object.  It is converted to point to the pointer type
    1224             : indicated by result->type, and the new constant is returned in *result.
    1225             : bcp points to the base class entry for the current type relative to the
    1226             : desired derived type.  If there is an error, it is issued at *err_pos.
    1227             : If error_detected is non-NULL, set *error_detected to the code for any

    1280             :          class has to be within the underlying object. */

    1306          13 : static void conv_pointer_to_whatever(
    1307             :                                     a_constant        *old_constant,
    1308             :                                     a_constant        *new_constant,
    1309             :                                     a_boolean         check_cast_access,
    1310             :                                     a_boolean         check_ambiguity,
    1311             :                                     a_boolean         is_implicit_cast,
    1312             :                                     a_boolean         fold_constant_addr_exprs,
    1313             :                                     a_boolean         is_reinterpret_cast,
    1314             :                                     a_boolean         is_object_pointer,
    1315             :                                     a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    1316             :                                     a_source_position *err_pos,
    1317             :                                     an_error_code     *err_code,
    1318             :                                     an_error_severity *err_severity,
    1319             :                                     a_boolean         suppress_complex_diags)
    1320             : /*
    1321             : Convert a pointer constant to a constant of type as specified by
    1322             : "new_constant".  If check_cast_access is TRUE, do access checking.
    1323             : If check_ambiguity is TRUE, check for ambiguous base class casts.
    1324             : If is_implicit_cast is TRUE, the cast is implicit.  If
    1325             : fold_constant_addr_exprs is TRUE, fold related class casts in constant
    1326             : form; if it's FALSE, do not do such folding and return *did_not_fold
    1327             : TRUE.  If is_reinterpret_cast is TRUE, this is a reinterpret_cast;
    1328             : related class casts are treated like casts between unrelated classes.
    1329             : If is_object_pointer is TRUE, the pointer is considered a pointer to
    1330             : an object; that's used to implement offsetof, where we want a zero
    1331             : pointer not to be treated like a null pointer.
    1332             : If there is an error, either issue it immediately at *err_pos (if it
    1333             : cannot be reduced to a warning in a nonconstant context), or return
    1334             : *err_code and *err_severity set appropriately.  If suppress_complex_diags
    1335             : is TRUE, suppress (and return in err_code/err_severity) also those
    1336             : complex diagnostics (e.g., those for access errors) that can't be
    1337             : issued simply from the error code.  Note that this routine
    1338             : is also called when the old constant is an address constant that has
    1339             : previously been cast to an integral type, and so does not have pointer
    1340             : type.
    1341             : */
    1342             : {
    1343          13 :   a_type_ptr       new_type = new_constant->type;
    1344          13 :   a_type_ptr       old_type = old_constant->type;
    1345          13 :   a_boolean        conversion_handled = FALSE, baseward_cast;
    1346          13 :   a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    1347          13 :   an_error_code    *p_err_code = NULL;
    1348             : 
    1349          13 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    1350          13 :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    1351          13 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    1352          13 :   if (suppress_complex_diags) p_err_code = err_code;
    1353             : #if CHECKING
    1354          13 :   if (old_constant->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
    1355           0 :       old_constant->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer &&
    1356             :       old_constant->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param) {
    1357           0 :     internal_error("conv_pointer_to_whatever: invalid constant kind");
    1358             :   }  /* if */
    1359             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    1360             :   /* Change of pointer type for an address or template parameter constant. */
    1361             :   /* Change of pointer type for an integer cast to a pointer type. */
    1362             :   /* Change of an address constant previously cast to integer to another
    1363             :      type. */
    1364          13 :   if (is_integral_or_enum_type(new_type)) {
    1365             :     /* Pointer value being forced into an integral type. */
    1366           0 :     if (old_constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    1367             :       /* A constant that is an integer, cast to some pointer type and back
    1368             :          to integer, as in (int)(void*)-1: make sure the integer is
    1369             :          truncated and sign-extended properly, with warnings if
    1370             :          appropriate. */
    1371           0 :       conv_integer_to_integer(old_constant, new_constant, is_implicit_cast,
    1372             :                               err_code, err_severity);
    1373           0 :       conversion_handled = TRUE;
    1374           0 :     } else if (skip_typerefs(new_type)->size < skip_typerefs(old_type)->size) {
    1375             :       /* The integral type is not large enough to hold a pointer. */
    1376           0 :       *err_code = ec_integer_truncated;
    1377           0 :       *err_severity = es_error;
    1378             :     }  /* if */
    1379          13 :   } else if (is_floating_type(new_type)) {
    1380             :     /* Converting an address to a floating-point type cannot be done at
    1381             :        compile-time. */
    1382           0 :     *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    1383          13 :   } else if (is_reinterpret_cast) {
    1384             :     /* Suppress the related-class processing for reinterpret_casts.  If
    1385             :        constant addressing expressions are not being folded, keep the
    1386             :        reinterpret_cast in executable form.  But do fold casts of
    1387             :        a null pointer value. */
    1388           0 :     if (!fold_constant_addr_exprs && !is_null_pointer_value(old_constant)) {
    1389           0 :       *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    1390             :     }  /* if */
    1391          13 :   } else if (related_class_pointers(old_type, new_type,
    1392             :                                     &baseward_cast, &bcp)) {
    1393             :     /* In C++, a cast of a pointer to a class to a pointer to a base class
    1394             :        or derived class. */
    1395           0 :     conversion_handled = TRUE;
    1396             :     /* Do not fold such casts in constant form unless told to.  That's to
    1397             :        preserve detailed addressing information in the IL. */
    1398           0 :     if (!fold_constant_addr_exprs) {
    1399           0 :       *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    1400           0 :     } else if (baseward_cast) {
    1401             :       /* Derived --> base.  Valid unless the cast is ambiguous or
    1402             :          the base class is inaccessible. */
    1403           0 :       fold_base_class_cast(old_constant, bcp, type_pointed_to(new_type),
    1404             :                            new_constant,
    1405             :                            check_cast_access, check_ambiguity,
    1406             :                            is_implicit_cast, is_object_pointer,
    1407             :                            /*omit_back_expr=*/FALSE,
    1408             :                            did_not_fold, err_pos, p_err_code);
    1409           0 :       if (p_err_code != NULL && *err_code != ec_no_error) {
    1410           0 :         *err_severity = es_error;
    1411             :       }  /* if */
    1412             :     } else {
    1413             :       /* Base --> derived.  Valid unless the cast is ambiguous or the base

    1418           0 :         *err_severity = es_error;

    1420             :     }  /* if */

    1435          13 : }  /* conv_pointer_to_whatever */

    1438           0 : static a_type_ptr pm_constant_member_class(a_constant_ptr constant)

    1458             : 
    1459           0 : static void set_pm_cast_base_class(a_constant_ptr   constant, 
    1460             :                                    a_type_ptr       new_type,
    1461             :                                    a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    1462             :                                    a_boolean        cast_to_base,
    1463             :                                    a_boolean        is_implicit_cast,
    1464             :                                    a_boolean        *did_not_fold)
    1465             : /*
    1466             : constant is a pointer-to-member constant.  Cast it to new_type, which is
    1467             : a pointer to member of the class indicated by bcp.  If cast_to_base is TRUE,
    1468             : this cast is toward a base class; otherwise, it is toward a derived class
    1469             : (in which case bcp gives the base class entry for the current class as
    1470             : a base class of the derived class).  is_implicit_cast is TRUE if the
    1471             : cast is implicit.  If the cast cannot be folded, *did_not_fold is
    1472             : returned TRUE.
    1473             : */

    1482             :        when cast to another type. */

    1554             : 
    1555           0 : static void fold_pm_base_class_cast(a_constant        *constant_1,
    1556             :                                     a_base_class      *bcp,
    1557             :                                     a_constant        *result,
    1558             :                                     a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    1559             :                                     a_source_position *err_pos,
    1560             :                                     an_error_code     *error_detected)
    1561             : /*
    1562             : Fold a C++ cast of a pointer to a member of a class to pointer to a member
    1563             : of a base class.  constant_1 is a pointer-to-member constant.  It is converted
    1564             : to a pointer-to-member for the base class indicated by bcp and the new
    1565             : constant is returned in *result.  result->type on entry indicates the
    1566             : desired pointer-to-member type, possibly with qualifiers.  If there is an
    1567             : error, issue it at *err_pos.  If the cast cannot be folded, *did_not_fold
    1568             : is returned TRUE.  If error_detected is non-NULL, set *error_detected
    1569             : to the code for any error detected, and do not issue the diagnostic,
    1570             : or set it to ec_no_error if there was no error.  Note that casts of
    1571             : this type always come from explicit casts, so checking for
    1572             : accessibility of base classes is not necessary.
    1573             : */
    1574             : {
    1575           0 :   a_type_ptr new_type = result->type;
    1576             : 
    1577             :   /* The code here looks like add_pm_base_class_casts. */
    1578           0 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    1579           0 :   if (error_detected != NULL) *error_detected = ec_no_error;
    1580           0 :   if (bcp->ambiguous) {
    1581             :     /* The base class is ambiguous. */
    1582           0 :     if (error_detected != NULL) {
    1583           0 :       *error_detected = ec_ambiguous_base_class;
    1584             :     } else {
    1585           0 :       pos_ty_error(ec_ambiguous_base_class, err_pos, bcp->type);
    1586             :     }  /* if */
    1587           0 :     set_error_constant(result);
    1588           0 :   } else if (any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(bcp) && !any_cfront_mode()) {
    1589             :     /* The base class is a virtual base of the derived class, or there's a
    1590             :        virtual step on the derivation path. */
    1591           0 :     if (error_detected != NULL) {
    1592           0 :       *error_detected = ec_pm_virtual_base_from_derived_class;

    1597           0 :     set_error_constant(result);
    1598             :   } else {
    1599           0 :     copy_constant(constant_1, result);
    1600             :     /* Set the constant to indicate the cast. */
    1601           0 :     set_pm_cast_base_class(result, new_type, bcp, /*cast_to_base=*/TRUE,
    1602             :                            /*is_implicit_cast=*/FALSE, did_not_fold);

    1607           0 : static void fold_pm_derived_class_cast(a_constant        *constant_1,

    1613             :                                        a_source_position *err_pos,
    1614             :                                        an_error_code     *error_detected)
    1615             : /*
    1616             : Fold a C++ cast of a pointer to a member of a class to pointer to member
    1617             : of a derived class.  constant_1 is a pointer-to-member constant.  It is
    1618             : converted to a pointer-to-member for the derived class (given by
    1619             : result->type) and the new constant is returned in *result.  bcp points
    1620             : to the base class entry for the current type relative to the desired
    1621             : derived type.  The cast is implicit if is_implicit_cast is TRUE.
    1622             : Access should be checked if check_cast_access is TRUE.  If there is an

    1697             : static a_boolean related_classes_single_inh(a_type_ptr class_1,

    1699             : /*
    1700             : Return TRUE if the class types given are related by inheritance or are

    1719           0 : static void conv_ptr_to_member_to_ptr_to_member(
    1720             :                                       a_constant        *old_constant,
    1721             :                                       a_constant        *new_constant,
    1722             :                                       a_boolean         is_implicit_cast,
    1723             :                                       a_boolean         check_cast_access,
    1724             :                                       a_boolean         is_reinterpret_cast,
    1725             :                                       a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    1726             :                                       a_source_position *err_pos,
    1727             :                                       an_error_code     *err_code,
    1728             :                                       an_error_severity *err_severity,
    1729             :                                       a_boolean         suppress_complex_diags)
    1730             : /*
    1731             : Convert a pointer-to-member constant to a pointer-to-member constant of
    1732             : a different type.  old_constant is the original constant.  new_constant->type
    1733             : indicates the desired new type.  The converted constant is put into
    1734             : *new_constant.  This is an implicit cast if is_implicit_cast is TRUE.
    1735             : Check access if check_cast_access is TRUE.  This is a reinterpret_cast
    1736             : if is_reinterpret_cast is TRUE.  If the cast cannot be folded,
    1737             : *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.  Return err_code and *err_severity set
    1738             : *to indicate any error/warning detected, or *err_code == ec_no_error
    1739             : *if everything went fine.  If suppress_complex_diags is TRUE, suppress
    1740             : (and return in err_code/err_severity) also those complex diagnostics
    1741             : (e.g., those for access errors) that can't be issued simply from the
    1742             : error code.
    1743             : */
    1744             : {
    1745           0 :   a_type_ptr       new_type = new_constant->type, new_class;
    1746           0 :   a_type_ptr       old_type = old_constant->type, old_class;
    1747           0 :   a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    1748           0 :   an_error_code    *p_err_code = NULL;
    1749             : 
    1750           0 :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    1751           0 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    1752           0 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    1753           0 :   if (suppress_complex_diags) p_err_code = err_code;

    1755           0 :   new_class = pm_class_type(new_type);

    1759           0 :         old_constant->variant.ptr_to_member.casting_base_class != NULL) {

    1762           0 :       *did_not_fold = TRUE;

    1767             :          is zero and inheritance is single.  Otherwise they get an error.

    1769             :       *did_not_fold = TRUE;

    1897             : 
    1898           0 : static void issue_folding_diagnostic(an_error_code     err_code,
    1899             :                                      an_error_severity err_severity,
    1900             :                                      a_boolean         constant_context,
    1901             :                                      a_boolean         evaluated_context,
    1902             :                                      a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    1903             :                                      an_error_code     *error_detected,
    1904             :                                      a_source_position *err_pos,
    1905             :                                      a_constant        *result)
    1906             : /*
    1907             : An error or warning has been detected in a folding operation; err_code
    1908             : and err_severity indicate what it is.  If not in a constant_context, reduce
    1909             : an error to a warning and set *did_not_fold to TRUE.  If not in an
    1910             : evaluated_context, throw away the error and set *did_not_fold to TRUE.
    1911             : If error_detected is non-NULL, the caller would like to know that an
    1912             : error was detected but does not want it issued at this level.  Return
    1913             : *error_detected set to the code for the error detected, or ec_no_error
    1914             : if no error was detected, and suppress any diagnostic.  If a
    1915             : diagnostic is issued, do so with source position *err_pos.  Set
    1916             : *result to the proper result (often, an error constant).
    1917             : */
    1918             : {
    1919           0 :   if (error_detected != NULL) *error_detected = ec_no_error;
    1920           0 :   if (!evaluated_context) {
    1921             :     /* Discard a warning or error in a not-evaluated context. */
    1922           0 :     err_severity = es_none;
    1923           0 :     *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    1924           0 :   } else if (!constant_context ||
    1925           0 :              (expr_stack != NULL && curr_expr_is_potentially_unevaluated())) {
    1926             :     /* Nonconstant or potentially unevaluated context, so an error will not
    1927             :        be issued.  It will be downgraded to a warning.  If the expression
    1928             :        actually does end up being evaluated in a constant context, the fact
    1929             :        that folding was not done will result in an error at that point. */
    1930           0 :     if (err_severity == es_error) {
    1931             :       /* Reduce an error to a warning. */
    1932           0 :       err_severity = es_warning;
    1933           0 :       *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    1934             :     }  /* if */
    1935             :   } else {
    1936             :     /* Constant context, so errors can be issued.  Check for a requested
    1937             :        increase of severity on a warning. */
    1938           0 :     if (err_severity != es_error &&
    1939           0 :         is_effective_sfinae_error(err_code, err_severity)) {
    1940             :       err_severity = es_error;
    1941             :     }  /* if */
    1942             :   }  /* if */
    1943           0 :   if (err_severity == es_error) {
    1944             :     /* We have an error. */
    1945           0 :     if (error_detected != NULL) {
    1946             :       /* The caller wants an error indication rather than a diagnostic. */
    1947           0 :       *error_detected = err_code;
    1948             :     } else {
    1949           0 :       pos_error(err_code, err_pos);
    1950             :     }  /* if */
    1951           0 :     set_error_constant(result);
    1952           0 :     *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    1953           0 :   } else if (error_detected != NULL) {
    1954             :     /* At most we have a warning, and we're suppressing diagnostics, so
    1955             :        skip the rest of the checks. */
    1956           0 :   } else if (err_severity == es_warning) {
    1957           0 :     pos_warning(err_code, err_pos);
    1958             :   }  /* if */
    1959           0 : }  /* issue_folding_diagnostic */
    1960             : 
    1961             : 
    1962             : #if !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1963             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- is_cli_attr_arg_expression is not used in that case. */
    1964             : #endif /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1965       87063 : void type_change_constant_full(a_constant        *constant,
    1966             :                                a_type_ptr        new_type,
    1967             :                                a_boolean         is_implicit_cast,
    1968             :                                a_boolean         constant_context,
    1969             :                                a_boolean         evaluated_context,
    1970             :                                a_boolean         fold_constant_addr_exprs,
    1971             :                                a_boolean         is_cli_attr_arg_expression,
    1972             :                                a_boolean         check_cast_access,
    1973             :                                a_boolean         check_ambiguity,
    1974             :                                a_boolean         is_reinterpret_cast,
    1975             :                                a_boolean         maintain_expression,
    1976             :                                a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    1977             :                                an_error_code     *error_detected,
    1978             :                                a_source_position *err_pos)
    1979             : /*
    1980             : Convert the indicated constant to "new_type".  If is_implicit_cast is
    1981             : TRUE, this is an implicit cast; more warnings are given.  If
    1982             : constant_context is FALSE, this operation is being evaluated as part
    1983             : of a nonconstant expression, so any error is reduced to a warning and
    1984             : *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.  If evaluated_context is FALSE, this
    1985             : operation is being done in a not-evaluated context (e.g., a sizeof or
    1986             : a dead branch of a "?" operator), so any error is thrown away and
    1987             : *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.  *did_not_fold is also returned TRUE
    1988             : in other cases where the folding cannot be done.
    1989             : fold_constant_addr_exprs is TRUE if constant address expressions
    1990             : should be folded (e.g., base class casts); if it is FALSE,
    1991             : *did_not_fold is set instead for those.  check_cast_access is TRUE if
    1992             : access checking should be done on related-class casts.
    1993             : check_ambiguity is TRUE if ambiguity checking should be done on
    1994             : related-class casts.  If is_reinterpret_cast is TRUE, this cast is a
    1995             : reinterpret_cast; related-class casts are treated like casts between
    1996             : unrelated classes.  If maintain_expression is TRUE, any backing expression
    1997             : attached to the constant is maintained, by adding a cast if necessary.
    1998             : If error_detected is non-NULL, set *error_detected to the code for any
    1999             : error detected, and do not issue the diagnostic, or set it to
    2000             : ec_no_error if there was no error.  *err_pos is used as the position
    2001             : for any diagnostics issued.
    2002             : */
    2003             : {
    2004       87063 :   a_type_ptr        constant_type, new_type_with_typedefs;
    2005       87063 :   a_constant_ptr    new_constant = local_constant();
    2006       87063 :   an_error_code     err_code;
    2007       87063 :   an_error_severity err_severity;
    2008       87063 :   a_boolean         depends_on_fp_mode = FALSE;
    2009       87063 :   a_boolean         template_case;
    2010       87063 :   a_boolean         suppress_diags = (error_detected != NULL);
    2011             : 
    2012       87063 :   db_enter(5, "type_change_constant_full");
    2013       87063 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    2014       87063 :   if (error_detected != NULL) *error_detected = ec_no_error;
    2015       87063 :   err_code = ec_no_error;

    2017       87063 :   clear_constant(new_constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_error);

    2122        9230 :   if (vla_enabled && !is_implicit_cast &&
    2123        1290 :       is_directly_variably_modified_type(new_type)) {
    2124             :     /* A cast to a variably-modified type where the variable bound appears
    2125             :        in the cast (an opposed to inside a typedef declared elsewhere) is
    2126             :        a non-constant operation and cannot be folded. */

    2396       87063 : exit:
    2397       87063 :   if (!new_constant->null_pointer_constant_ruled_out) {
    2398             :     /* Look for casts that rule out use of a constant as part of a null
    2399             :        pointer constant.  In a null pointer constant, only casts from
    2400             :        arithmetic to integral types, or, in C, from integral to "void *",
    2401             :        are allowed.  This processing is to rule out things like
    2402             :        (int)(float)0, which are not valid null pointer constants.
    2403             :        Also really obscure things like (int)(float)2 - 2.  This
    2404             :        processing is more or less tracking whether a constant could
    2405             :        be an integral constant expression, even when it is scanned
    2406             :        in other modes. */
    2407       86999 :     if (microsoft_bugs && !C_mode() && !is_implicit_cast &&

    2409             :       /* Microsoft C++ mode: any explicit cast makes a constant not a null

    2411             :          constant.  This was fixed in MSVC++ 7.1. */
    2412             :       new_constant->null_pointer_constant_ruled_out = TRUE;
    2413      171615 :     } else if (is_integral_or_enum_type(new_type) &&

    2534             : 
    2535      213526 : a_boolean is_false_constant(a_constant *constant)
    2536             : /*
    2537             : Return TRUE if the constant is an integer, floating, pointer, or
    2538             : pointer to member zero.  This is supposed to duplicate the test on
    2539             : the boolean controlling expressions in statements and the ?:, &&, and ||
    2540             : operators.  Can also be used to test for a NULL pointer or pointer to member.
    2541             : */
    2542             : {
    2543      213526 :   a_boolean is_false = FALSE;
    2544             : 
    2545             :   /* The value of a link-time constant is not known until link time, so
    2546             :      one cannot decide whether it is true or false.  Such constants should
    2547             :      not get here. */
    2548      213526 :   check_assertion_str(constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(constant),
    2549      213526 :                       "is_false_constant: link-time constant");
    2550             :   /* ck_address constants that aren't link-time constants are assumed to
    2551             :      be non-NULL.  For example, the address of an auto variable. */
    2552      213526 :   if (is_zero_constant(constant)) {
    2553             :     /* Zero integral, fixed-point, or floating constant. */
    2554             :     is_false = TRUE;
    2555      104442 :   } else if (is_null_pointer_value(constant)) {
    2556             :     /* A NULL pointer value (0 cast to a pointer type). */
    2557             :     is_false = TRUE;
    2558      104442 :   } else if (constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer &&

    2560           0 :              is_nullptr_type(constant->type)) {

    2562             :     is_false = TRUE;
    2563      104442 :   } else if (constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_ptr_to_member) {

    2565           0 :     is_false = pm_constant_is_null(constant);
    2566             :   }  /* if */

    2933             : /*

    2942             : 
    2943             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
    2944           0 : static void decompose_vector_unary_operation(
    2945             :                                       an_expr_operator_kind op,
    2946             :                                       a_constant            *constant,
    2947             :                                       a_type_ptr            result_type,
    2948             :                                       a_constant            *result,
    2949             :                                       a_boolean             constant_context,
    2950             :                                       a_boolean             evaluated_context,
    2951             :                                       a_boolean             *did_not_fold,
    2952             :                                       a_boolean             *template_constant,
    2953             :                                       an_error_code         *error_detected,
    2954             :                                       a_source_position     *err_pos)
    2955             : /*
    2956             : Called by unary_operation when the result type is a GNU vector type to
    2957             : recursively perform the specified operation on each of the vector's
    2958             : elements.  Produces in *result a vector ck_aggregate constant with the
    2959             : number of elements specified by the vector type, allocating the element
    2960             : constants in the current memory region.  See unary_operation for a full
    2961             : description of the parameters.
    2962             : */
    2963             : {
    2964           0 :   a_constant_ptr opnd_elem;
    2965           0 :   a_boolean      opnd_local_constant = FALSE;
    2966           0 :   a_boolean      local_not_folded = FALSE;
    2967           0 :   sizeof_t       num_result_elements;
    2968           0 :   a_type_ptr     result_elem_type;
    2969           0 :   sizeof_t       elem_no;
    2970             : 
    2971           0 :   check_assertion(result_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_vector &&
    2972             :                   constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    2973           0 :   result_elem_type = result_type->variant.vector.element_type;
    2974           0 :   num_result_elements = result_type->size / result_elem_type->size;
    2975             :   /* Clone the operand constant and remove the operand elements to form the
    2976             :      basis for the result. */
    2977           0 :   copy_constant(constant, result);
    2978           0 :   result->variant.aggregate.first_constant = NULL;
    2979           0 :   result->variant.aggregate.last_constant = NULL;
    2980             :   /* Loop over the operand elements, calling unary_operation to compute
    2981             :      the values of the result elements. */
    2982           0 :   opnd_elem = constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant;
    2983           0 :   for (elem_no = 0; elem_no < num_result_elements && !local_not_folded;
    2984           0 :        ++elem_no) {
    2985           0 :     a_constant_ptr result_elem = alloc_constant(result_elem_type->kind);
    2986           0 :     if (opnd_elem == NULL) {
    2987             :       /* A vector aggregate may be partially- or value-initialized.  If so,
    2988             :          the operand element will be NULL at this point if we've stepped
    2989             :          past the end of the list, and we need to create a zero of the
    2990             :          element type to use for the rest of the loop. */
    2991           0 :       opnd_elem = local_constant();
    2992           0 :       opnd_local_constant = TRUE;
    2993           0 :       make_zero_of_proper_type(result_elem_type, opnd_elem);
    2994             :     }  /* if */
    2995             :     /* Recursively call unary_operation to compute the result for this
    2996             :        element and add the element to the result aggregate. */
    2997           0 :     unary_operation(op, opnd_elem, opnd_elem->type, result_elem,
    2998             :                     constant_context, evaluated_context, &local_not_folded,
    2999             :                     template_constant, error_detected, err_pos);
    3000           0 :     add_constant_to_aggregate(result_elem, result);
    3001             :     /* Step to the next element, unless we already ran off the end of the
    3002             :        operand aggregate and are using a local zero. */
    3003           0 :     if (!opnd_local_constant) {
    3004           0 :       opnd_elem = opnd_elem->next;
    3005             :     }  /* if */
    3006             :   }  /* for */
    3007             :   /* Release the local constant, if one was created. */
    3008           0 :   if (opnd_local_constant) {
    3009           0 :     release_local_constant(&opnd_elem);
    3010             :   }  /* if */
    3011             :   /* Propagate the result back to the caller. */
    3012           0 :   *did_not_fold = local_not_folded;
    3013           0 : }  /* decompose_vector_unary_operation */
    3014             : #endif /* GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED */
    3015             : 
    3016       29120 : void unary_operation(an_expr_operator_kind op,
    3017             :                      a_constant            *constant,
    3018             :                      a_type_ptr            result_type,
    3019             :                      a_constant            *result,
    3020             :                      a_boolean             constant_context,
    3021             :                      a_boolean             evaluated_context,
    3022             :                      a_boolean             *did_not_fold,
    3023             :                      a_boolean             *template_constant,
    3024             :                      an_error_code         *error_detected,
    3025             :                      a_source_position     *err_pos)
    3026             : /*
    3027             : Fold unary operations on constants.  op indicates the operation,
    3028             : constant the operand.  result_type indicates the desired result type.
    3029             : The result constant is put into result.  If constant_context is FALSE,
    3030             : this operation is being evaluated as part of a nonconstant expression,
    3031             : so any error is reduced to a warning and *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.
    3032             : If evaluated_context is FALSE, this operation is being done in a
    3033             : not-evaluated context (e.g., a sizeof or a dead branch of a "?" operator),
    3034             : so any error is thrown away and *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.
    3035             : *did_not_fold is also returned TRUE if the operation could not be
    3036             : folded for any other reason (*template_constant is returned TRUE if
    3037             : the reason is that the constant is a template parameter constant).
    3038             : If error_detected is non-NULL, set *error_detected to the code for any
    3039             : error detected, and do not issue the diagnostic, or set it to
    3040             : ec_no_error if there was no error.  *err_pos is used as the position
    3041             : for any diagnostics issued.
    3042             : */
    3043             : {
    3044       29120 :   an_error_code     err_code;
    3045       29120 :   an_error_severity err_severity;
    3046       29120 :   a_boolean         depends_on_fp_mode = FALSE;
    3047             : 
    3048       29120 :   db_enter(5, "unary_operation");
    3049             : 
    3050       29120 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    3051       29120 :   *template_constant = FALSE;
    3052       29120 :   if (error_detected != NULL) *error_detected = ec_no_error;
    3053       29120 :   err_code = ec_no_error;
    3054       29120 :   err_severity = es_warning;
    3055       29120 :   if (is_error_constant(constant)) {
    3056             :     /* The constant is an error constant; set the result to an error
    3057             :        constant and return. */
    3058           0 :     set_error_constant(result);
    3059       29120 :   } else if (!C_mode() &&
    3060        4587 :              (constant_is(constant, ck_template_param) ||
    3061        4876 :               (context_may_have_dependent_types() &&
    3062         289 :                is_template_dependent_type(constant->type)))) {

    3387       24632 : void check_shift_count(a_constant    *shift_count_constant,

    3390             : /*

    3392             : The entity being shifted has the type operand_type.  Check the shift

    3452       24616 : static void do_shift(a_constant        *constant_1,
    3453             :                      a_constant        *constant_2,
    3454             :                      a_constant        *result,
    3455             :                      a_boolean         shift_right,
    3456             :                      an_error_code     *err_code,
    3457             :                      an_error_severity *err_severity)
    3458             : /*
    3459             : Low-level routine to do a left or right shift on an integer.  Shift
    3460             : *constant_1 by *constant_2 (right if shift_right is TRUE, left otherwise),

    3463             : everything went fine.

    3472             : 
    3473       24616 :   check_shift_count(constant_2, constant_1->type, err_code);
    3474       24616 :   if (*err_code != ec_no_error) {
    3475             :     /* Something wrong with the shift count. */
    3476           0 :     if (*err_code == ec_shift_count_too_large) {
    3477             :       /* The shift count is too large. */
    3478           0 :       too_large = TRUE;
    3479           0 :       if (microsoft_mode || gnu_mode) {
    3480             :         /* Too-large shift counts are only warnings in Microsoft and GNU
    3481             :            modes. */
    3482             :       } else {
    3483           0 :         *err_severity = es_error;
    3484             :       }  /* if */
    3485             :     } else {
    3486             :       /* Other errors (e.g., negative shift count) are always errors.
    3487             :          Microsoft doesn't give errors, but it's not clear what they do,
    3488             :          so we don't try to emulate the folding. */
    3489           0 :       *err_severity = es_error;
    3490             :     }  /* if */
    3491             :   }  /* if */
    3492       24616 :   if (*err_severity != es_error) {
    3493             :     /* Fold the shift. */
    3494       24616 :     result_value = constant_1->variant.integer_value;
    3495       24616 :     if (too_large) {
    3496             :       /* Adjust the shift count for a too-large value. */
    3497           0 :       int object_bit_size =
    3498           0 :                   (int)((skip_typerefs(constant_1->type)->size)*targ_char_bit);
    3499           0 :       if (targ_too_large_shift_count_is_taken_modulo_size) {
    3500             :         /* We're supposed to reduce the shift count modulo the bit size
    3501             :            of the object. */
    3502           0 :         shift_count = (int)value_of_integer_constant(constant_2, &err);
    3503           0 :         if (err) {
    3504             :           /* The number is huge.  Give up. */
    3505           0 :           *err_severity = es_error;
    3506           0 :           goto end_of_folding;
    3507             :         }  /* if */
    3508           0 :         shift_count %= object_bit_size;
    3509             :       } else {
    3510             :         /* We're supposed to treat the shift count as if we really shift
    3511             :            that many bits.  Just shift the amount beyond which we would
    3512             :            not get any further change, i.e., the number of bits in the
    3513             :            object.  Do it in two steps so that the low-level routines
    3514             :            need not deal with the odd cases. */
    3515           0 :         shift_count = object_bit_size-1;
    3516           0 :         extra_shift_count = 1;
    3517             :       }  /* if */
    3518             :     } else {
    3519             :       /* Normal shift count, not too big. */
    3520       24616 :       shift_count = (int)value_of_integer_constant(constant_2, &err);
    3521             :       /* No need to check err because check_shift_count has already
    3522             :          established that the shift count is reasonable. */
    3523             :     }  /* if */
    3524       24616 :     if (shift_right) {
    3525             :       /* Shift right. */
    3526         288 :       is_signed = int_constant_is_signed(constant_1);
    3527             :       /* If the operation is signed but the shift is unsigned, mask off the
    3528             :          high order bits of the integer value that are not actually part of
    3529             :          the value to be shifted.  This prevents those high order bits from
    3530             :          being shifted in to the result. */

    3532           0 :         an_integer_kind         tmp_ikind;

    3545           0 :         shift_right_integer_value(&result_value, extra_shift_count, is_signed,
    3546             :                                /*sign_extend=*/targ_right_shift_is_arithmetic);

    3549             :       /* Shift left. */

    3676       33256 : static void do_icompare(a_constant            *constant_1,
    3677             :                         an_expr_operator_kind op,
    3678             :                         a_constant            *constant_2,
    3679             :                         a_constant            *result)
    3680             : /*
    3681             : Compare integers constant_1 and constant_2 according to the relational
    3682             : operator "op", and return a 0 or 1 integer in "result".
    3683             : */
    3684             : {
    3685       33256 :   int   cmp;
    3686       33256 :   int   result_value = 0;
    3687             : 
    3688             :   /* Develop a strcmp-like relation value in cmp:
    3689             :        constant_1 > constant_2   1
    3690             :        constant_1 = constant_2   0
    3691             :        constant_1 < constant_2  -1
    3692             :   */

    3694             :   /* Now determine the result value for this particular operator. */
    3695       33256 :   switch (op) {
    3696        5041 :     case eok_eq:  result_value = (cmp == 0); break;
    3697         217 :     case eok_ne:  result_value = (cmp != 0); break;
    3698        3057 :     case eok_gt:  result_value = (cmp >  0); break;
    3699        2763 :     case eok_lt:  result_value = (cmp <  0); break;
    3700       22036 :     case eok_ge:  result_value = (cmp >= 0); break;
    3701         142 :     case eok_le:  result_value = (cmp <= 0); break;
    3702           0 :     default:      unexpected_condition_str("do_icompare: bad operator");
    3703             :   }  /* switch */
    3704       33256 :   set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);

    3706             :                     (a_host_large_integer)result_value);

    4051           0 : static void do_fcompare(a_constant            *constant_1,
    4052             :                         an_expr_operator_kind op,
    4053             :                         a_constant            *constant_2,
    4054             :                         a_constant            *result,
    4055             :                         a_boolean             *depends_on_fp_mode)
    4056             : /*
    4057             : Compare floating constants constant_1 and constant_2 according to the
    4058             : relational operator "op", and return a 0 or 1 integer in "result".
    4059             : */
    4060             : {
    4061           0 :   int          cmp;
    4062           0 :   int          result_value = 0;
    4063           0 :   a_boolean    unordered;
    4064           0 :   a_float_kind float_kind =
    4065           0 :                            skip_typerefs(constant_1->type)->variant.float_kind;
    4066             : 
    4067           0 :    *depends_on_fp_mode = FALSE;
    4068             :   /* Develop a strcmp-like relation value in cmp:
    4069             :        constant_1 > constant_2   1
    4070             :        constant_1 = constant_2   0
    4071             :        constant_1 < constant_2  -1
    4072             :      "unordered" is set if the two values are unordered with respect to one
    4073             :      another.
    4074             :   */
    4075           0 :   cmp = fp_compare(float_kind,
    4076             :                    &constant_1->variant.float_value,
    4077             :                    &constant_2->variant.float_value,
    4078             :                    &unordered);
    4079             :   /* Now determine the result value for this particular operator. */
    4080           0 :   if (unordered) {
    4081           0 :    *depends_on_fp_mode = TRUE;
    4082           0 :    if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne) {
    4083             :      /* If two values are unordered, they are unequal.  This is needed for
    4084             :         NaN != NaN. */
    4085             :      result_value = 1;
    4086             :    } else {
    4087           0 :      result_value = 0;
    4088             :    }  /* if */
    4089             :   } else {
    4090           0 :     switch (op) {
    4091           0 :       case eok_eq:  result_value = (cmp == 0); break;
    4092           0 :       case eok_ne:  result_value = (cmp != 0); break;
    4093           0 :       case eok_gt:  result_value = (cmp >  0); break;
    4094           0 :       case eok_lt:  result_value = (cmp <  0); break;
    4095           0 :       case eok_ge:  result_value = (cmp >= 0); break;
    4096           0 :       case eok_le:  result_value = (cmp <= 0); break;
    4097           0 :       default:      unexpected_condition_str("do_fcompare: bad operator");
    4098             :     }  /* switch */
    4099             :   }  /* if */
    4100           0 :   set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    4101           0 :   set_integer_value(&result->variant.integer_value,
    4102             :                     (a_host_large_integer)result_value);
    4103             : 
    4104             : #if DEBUG
    4105           0 :   db_binary_operation(db_operator_names[op],
    4106             :                       constant_1, constant_2, result, ec_no_error);
    4107             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    4108           0 : }  /* do_fcompare */

    4277           0 : static void do_fgnu_min_max(a_constant            *constant_1,
    4278             :                             an_expr_operator_kind op,
    4279             :                             a_constant            *constant_2,
    4280             :                             a_constant            *result)
    4281             : /*
    4282             : Compare floating constant_1 and constant_2 and return the minimum or maximum
    4283             : in result (depending on which operator is indicated by op).  This folds the
    4284             : GNU C++ minimum and maximum operators ("<?" and ">?").
    4285             : */
    4286             : {
    4287           0 :   a_boolean    unordered;
    4288           0 :   a_float_kind float_kind =
    4289           0 :                            skip_typerefs(constant_1->type)->variant.float_kind;
    4290           0 :   int          order = fp_compare(float_kind,
    4291             :                                   &constant_1->variant.float_value,
    4292             :                                   &constant_2->variant.float_value,
    4293             :                                   &unordered);
    4294             : 
    4295           0 :   if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_gnu_min) {
    4296           0 :     if (!unordered && order < 0) {
    4297             :       /* The first constant is less than the second. */
    4298           0 :       copy_constant(constant_1, result);
    4299             :     } else {
    4300           0 :       copy_constant(constant_2, result);
    4301             :     }  /* if */
    4302             :   } else {
    4303             :     /* Evaluate the C++ maximum operator. */
    4304           0 :     if (!unordered && order > 0) {
    4305           0 :       copy_constant(constant_1, result);
    4306             :     } else {
    4307           0 :       copy_constant(constant_2, result);
    4308             :     }  /* if */
    4309             :   }  /* if */

    4406           0 :   get_complex_val(constant_2, &cx2);
    4407           0 :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    4408           0 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    4409           0 :   set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_complex);
    4410           0 :   cx_multiply(float_kind, &cx1, &cx2,
    4411           0 :               result->variant.complex_value, &err, depends_on_fp_mode);
    4412           0 :   if (err) {
    4413           0 :     *err_code = ec_bad_complex_operation_result;
    4414           0 :     *err_severity = es_error;

    4422           0 : static void do_xdivide(a_constant        *constant_1,
    4423             :                        a_constant        *constant_2,
    4424             :                        a_constant        *result,
    4425             :                        an_error_code     *err_code,
    4426             :                        an_error_severity *err_severity,
    4427             :                        a_boolean         *depends_on_fp_mode)
    4428             : /*
    4429             : Do the division operation on all types of complex.
    4430             : */

    4432           0 :   a_boolean                err, accum_err = FALSE, depends_on_mode;
    4433           0 :   a_type_ptr               constant_type = skip_typerefs(constant_1->type);
    4434           0 :   a_float_kind             float_kind = constant_type->variant.float_kind;

    4440           0 :   get_complex_val(constant_2, &cx2);

    4442           0 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    4443             : 
    4444           0 :   set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_complex);
    4445             : #if 0
    4446             :   /* This is an oversimplified algorithm that can exhibit dynamic range
    4447             :      problems (e.g., catastrophic cancellation).  Also, this is nearly
    4448             :      identical to cx_divide, except is creates an ec_divide_by_zero error
    4449             :      code in some cases. */

    4461             :          &err, &depends_on_mode);

    4523             : /*

    4540           0 :   if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne) {
    4541           0 :     result_value = !result_value;

    4543           0 :     check_assertion(op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_eq);
    4544             :   }  /* if */

    4644           0 : static void do_real_imag_add_subtract(
    4645             :                                      a_constant            *constant_1,
    4646             :                                      an_expr_operator_kind op,
    4647             :                                      a_constant            *constant_2,
    4648             :                                      a_constant            *result,
    4649             :                                      an_error_code         *err_code,
    4650             :                                      an_error_severity     *err_severity,
    4651             :                                      a_boolean             *depends_on_fp_mode)
    4652             : /*
    4653             : Do mixed real/imaginary addition and subtraction, i.e.,
    4654             : 
    4655             :   eok_fjadd      real      + imaginary
    4656             :   eok_jfadd      imaginary + real
    4657             :   eok_fjsubtract real      - imaginary
    4658             :   eok_jfsubtract imaginary - real
    4659             : 
    4660             : These differ from simply converting to complex and adding, by the
    4661             : preservation of negative zeroes.
    4662             : */
    4663             : {
    4664           0 :   a_boolean    err = FALSE;
    4665           0 :   a_type_ptr   constant_type = skip_typerefs(constant_1->type);
    4666           0 :   a_float_kind float_kind = constant_type->variant.float_kind;
    4667             : 
    4668           0 :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    4669           0 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    4670           0 :   *depends_on_fp_mode = FALSE;
    4671             : 
    4672           0 :   set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_complex);
    4673           0 :   switch (op) {
    4674           0 :     case eok_fjadd:
    4675             :       /* Real + imaginary. */
    4676           0 :       result->variant.complex_value->real = constant_1->variant.float_value;
    4677           0 :       result->variant.complex_value->imag = constant_2->variant.float_value;
    4678           0 :       break;
    4679           0 :     case eok_jfadd:
    4680             :       /* Imaginary + real. */
    4681           0 :       result->variant.complex_value->imag = constant_1->variant.float_value;
    4682           0 :       result->variant.complex_value->real = constant_2->variant.float_value;
    4683           0 :       break;
    4684           0 :     case eok_fjsubtract:
    4685             :       /* Real - imaginary. */
    4686           0 :       result->variant.complex_value->real = constant_1->variant.float_value;
    4687           0 :       fp_negate(float_kind,
    4688             :                 &constant_2->variant.float_value,
    4689             :                 &result->variant.complex_value->imag,
    4690             :                 &err, depends_on_fp_mode);
    4691           0 :       break;
    4692           0 :     case eok_jfsubtract:
    4693             :       /* Imaginary - real. */
    4694           0 :       result->variant.complex_value->imag = constant_1->variant.float_value;
    4695           0 :       fp_negate(float_kind,
    4696             :                 &constant_2->variant.float_value,
    4697             :                 &result->variant.complex_value->real,
    4698             :                 &err, depends_on_fp_mode);
    4699           0 :       break;
    4700           0 :     default:
    4701           0 :       unexpected_condition_str("do_real_imag_add_subtract: bad operator");
    4702             :   }  /* switch */
    4703           0 :   if (err) {
    4704           0 :     *err_code = ec_bad_complex_operation_result;

    4707             : #if DEBUG

    4714             : 
    4715           0 : static a_boolean valid_address_constant(a_constant *constant)
    4716             : /*
    4717             : Return TRUE if the given address constant is valid.  Specifically, check that
    4718             : the offset in it falls within the base object.  This is used for subscript
    4719             : checking.
    4720             : */
    4721             : {
    4722           0 :   a_boolean      valid;
    4723           0 :   a_targ_size_t  object_size = 0;
    4724           0 :   a_type_ptr     tp;
    4725           0 :   a_constant_ptr cp;
    4726             : 
    4727           0 :   if (constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    4728             :     /* Integer cast to a pointer.  Don't know the underlying
    4729             :        object.  Assume the pointer is okay. */
    4730             :     valid = TRUE;
    4731             :   } else {
    4732             : #if CHECKING
    4733           0 :     if (constant->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address) {
    4734           0 :       internal_error("valid_address_constant: not ck_address or ck_integer");
    4735             :     }  /* if */
    4736             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    4737             :     /* Determine the size of the object pointed to. */
    4738           0 :     switch(constant->variant.address.kind) {
    4739           0 :       case abk_variable:
    4740           0 :         tp = skip_typerefs(constant->variant.address.variant.variable->type);
    4741             :         /* Ignore incomplete arrays and flexible arrays. */
    4742           0 :         if (!is_incomplete_type(tp) &&
    4743           0 :             !(is_immediate_class_type(tp) &&
    4744             :               tp->variant.class_struct_union.contains_flexible_array_member)) {
    4745           0 :           object_size = tp->size;
    4746             :         }  /* if */
    4747             :         break;
    4748             :       case abk_routine:
    4749             :       case abk_label:
    4750             :         /* No size to check. */
    4751             :         break;
    4752           0 :       case abk_constant:
    4753           0 :         cp = constant->variant.address.variant.constant;
    4754           0 :         if (cp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string) {
    4755           0 :           object_size = cp->variant.string.length;
    4756             :         } else {
    4757           0 :           object_size = skip_typerefs(cp->type)->size;
    4758             :         }  /* if */
    4759             :         break;
    4760           0 :       case abk_temporary:
    4761           0 :         cp = constant->variant.address.variant.constant;
    4762           0 :         object_size = skip_typerefs(cp->type)->size;
    4763           0 :         break;
    4764           0 :       case abk_uuidof:
    4765           0 :         tp = type_pointed_to(constant->type);
    4766           0 :         object_size = tp->size;
    4767           0 :         break;
    4768             :       case abk_typeid:
    4769             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4770             :       case abk_cli_typeid:
    4771             :       case abk_cli_array:
    4772             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4773             :         /* The object is std::type_info or a class derived from it, or a
    4774             :            handle to a C++/CLI System::String or System::Array.  Therefore, we
    4775             :            don't really know the actual size. */
    4776             :         break;
    4777           0 :       default:
    4778           0 :         unexpected_condition_str(
    4779             :                           "valid_address_constant: bad address constant kind");
    4780             :     }  /* switch */
    4781             :     /* See if the offset is valid given the size. */
    4782           0 :     if (constant->variant.address.offset < 0) {
    4783             :       /* A negative offset is never valid. */
    4784             :       valid = FALSE;
    4785           0 :     } else if (object_size != 0) {
    4786             :       /* The offset right after the object is allowed.
    4787             :          ANSI C allows that for arrays to simplify some coding.  That
    4788             :          subscript value is flagged on a check of the subscript in expression
    4789             :          form, which would be the form of any reference of the entity as
    4790             :          an lvalue (see valid_node_if_subscript). */
    4791           0 :       a_targ_size_t offset = (a_targ_size_t)constant->variant.address.offset;
    4792           0 :       valid = (offset <= object_size);
    4793             :     } else {
    4794             :       /* Don't know what the size is, so assume the offset is valid. */
    4795             :       valid = TRUE;
    4796             :     }  /* if */
    4797             :   }  /* if */
    4798             : 
    4799           0 :   return valid;
    4800             : }  /* valid_address_constant */
    4801             : 
    4802             : 
    4803           0 : static a_targ_size_t gcc_stride_size(a_type_ptr type)
    4804             : /*
    4805             : Return the stride size to be used for a pointer operation on pointer-to-type
    4806             : in gcc mode.  gcc allows pointer addition and subtraction on pointer-to-void
    4807             : and pointer-to-function.
    4808             : */
    4809             : {
    4810           0 :   a_targ_size_t size;
    4811             : 
    4812           0 :   type = skip_typerefs(type);
    4813           0 :   if (is_void_type(type) ||
    4814           0 :       is_function_type(type)) {
    4815             :     size = 1;
    4816             :   } else {
    4817           0 :     size = type->size;
    4818             :   }  /* if */
    4819           0 :   return size;
    4820             : }  /* gcc_stride_size */
    4821             : 
    4822             : 
    4823           0 : static void accum_array_offset(a_constant_ptr  total_offset,
    4824             :                                a_boolean       offset_is_signed,
    4825             :                                a_boolean       subtract,
    4826             :                                a_constant_ptr  count,
    4827             :                                a_targ_size_t   elem_size,
    4828             :                                a_boolean       no_ovflo_on_unsigned_add,
    4829             :                                a_boolean       *ovflo,
    4830             :                                a_boolean       *did_not_fold)
    4831             : /*
    4832             : Perform the multiply-add or multiply-subtract implied by array subscripting
    4833             : or pointer arithmetic.  *total_offset is a constant to/from which the implied
    4834             : offset must be added/subtracted (subtract determines which operation it is).
    4835             : offset_is_signed determines whether *total_offset should be treated as a
    4836             : signed value (this can be different from the signedness implied by the type).
    4837             : count describes the number of array elements "added" or "subtracted", and
    4838             : elem_size is the size of each of those elements.  *ovflo is set to TRUE if an
    4839             : overflow occurs.  If an overflow resulting from an unsigned addition should
    4840             : be ignored, no_ovflo_on_unsigned_add should be set to TRUE.  If the
    4841             : operation could not be folded (because count is not a known integer
    4842             : constant), return *did_not_fold TRUE.
    4843             : */
    4844             : {
    4845           0 :   *ovflo = FALSE;
    4846           0 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    4847           0 :   if (count->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    4848           0 :     *did_not_fold = TRUE;

    4873             : 
    4874           0 : static void do_padd(a_constant            *constant_1,
    4875             :                     an_expr_operator_kind op,
    4876             :                     a_constant            *constant_2,
    4877             :                     a_constant            *result,
    4878             :                     a_boolean             *did_not_fold,
    4879             :                     an_error_code         *err_code,
    4880             :                     an_error_severity     *err_severity)
    4881             : /*
    4882             : Do addition or subtraction on one pointer (constant_1) and one integer
    4883             : (constant_2).  op indicates whether the source form was "+"
    4884             : (eok_padd), "[]" (eok_subscript), or "-" (eok_psubtract).
    4885             : Note that the integer can be of any type, specifically unsigned.
    4886             : Also used to add or subtract a constant from an address constant
    4887             : that has been cast to an integral type, as in "int i = (int)&j + 1;";
    4888             : in that case, the operator is eok_add or eok_subtract.
    4889             : *did_not_fold is returned TRUE if the operation cannot be folded.
    4890             : *err_code and *err_severity are set to indicate any error/warning
    4891             : detected, or *err_code == ec_no_error if everything went fine.
    4892             : */
    4893             : {
    4894           0 :   a_targ_size_t    size;
    4895           0 :   a_constant_ptr   offset = local_constant();
    4896           0 :   a_boolean        err = FALSE, offset_is_signed = FALSE;
    4897           0 :   a_boolean        integer_case = FALSE;
    4898             : 
    4899           0 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    4900           0 :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    4901           0 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    4902             : 
    4903           0 :   if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_add ||
    4904             :       op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subtract) {
    4905             :     /* For the (int)address +- constant case, the size (scaling) is 1. */
    4906             :     integer_case = TRUE;
    4907             :     size = 1;
    4908             :   } else {
    4909             :     /* Get the size of the thing pointed to. */
    4910           0 :     a_type_ptr  object_type =
    4911           0 :                            f_skip_typerefs(type_pointed_to(constant_1->type));
    4912           0 :     if (is_vla_type(object_type)) {
    4913             :       /* Can't do pointer arithmetic on a VLA types, since the size is not
    4914             :          known at compile time. */
    4915           0 :       *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    4916           0 :       goto have_result;
    4917           0 :     } else if (gcc_mode) {
    4918           0 :       size = gcc_stride_size(object_type);
    4919             :     } else {
    4920           0 :       size = object_type->size;
    4921             :     }  /* if */
    4922             :     /* gnu mode allows empty classes with size zero, so pointers to
    4923             :        such classes produce size zero here.  Likewise for some cases
    4924             :        of arrays with zero bounds in gnu mode. */
    4925           0 :     check_assertion_str(size != 0 || gnu_mode, "do_padd: size is zero");
    4926             :   }  /* if */
    4927             :   /* Get the offset from the first constant. */
    4928           0 :   get_pointer_offset(constant_1, offset);
    4929             :   /* When dealing with an address cast to an integral type, treat the
    4930             :      offset as having the signedness of the type cast to. */
    4931           0 :   offset_is_signed = integer_case ? int_constant_is_signed(constant_1) :
    4932           0 :                                     int_constant_is_signed(offset);
