    4935           0 :                      (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_psubtract ||
    4936           0 :                       op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subtract),
    4937           0 :                       constant_2, size, (integer_case && !offset_is_signed),
    4938             :                       &err, did_not_fold);
    4939           0 :   if (!err && !*did_not_fold) {
    4940             :     /* Build the result pointer constant. */
    4941           0 :     copy_constant(constant_1, result);
    4942           0 :     set_pointer_offset(result, offset, &err);
    4943           0 :     if (integer_case && !offset_is_signed) {
    4944             :       /* If this was an unsigned integer operation, overflow is ignored. */
    4945           0 :       err = FALSE;
    4946           0 :     } else if (constant_is(result, ck_address)) {
    4947             :       /* Record the change in the associated subobject path. */
    4948           0 :       a_subobject_path_ptr  *p_end_path = last_subobject_path_link(result);
    4949           0 :       *p_end_path = alloc_subobject_path();
    4950           0 :       (*p_end_path)->kind = (an_il_entry_kind)iek_constant;
    4951           0 :       (*p_end_path)->variant.ptr_offset =
    4952           0 :                                   value_of_integer_constant(constant_2, &err);
    4953           0 :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_psubtract ||
    4954             :           op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subtract) {
    4955           0 :         (*p_end_path)->variant.ptr_offset = -(*p_end_path)->variant.ptr_offset;
    4956             :       }  /* if */
    4957             :     }  /* if */
    4958             :   }  /* if */
    4959           0 : have_result:
    4960           0 :   if (err) {
    4961             :     /* Some folding error. */
    4962           0 :     *err_code = ec_integer_overflow;
    4963           0 :     *err_severity = es_error;
    4964           0 :   } else if (*did_not_fold) {
    4965           0 :     set_error_constant(result);
    4966             :   } else {
    4967             :     /* Check that the offset lies within the base object. */
    4968           0 :     if (!integer_case && !valid_address_constant(result)) {
    4969           0 :       if (cpp11_mode && !gnu_mode && !microsoft_mode) {
    4970             :         /* An out-of-bound address should not be folded to a constant in
    4971             :            C++11 (although g++ and MSVC do). */
    4972           0 :         *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    4973             :       }  /* if */
    4974             :       /* Use a different error message for cases where the original pointer
    4975             :          addition was coded in [] form. */
    4976           0 :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subscript) {
    4977           0 :         *err_code = ec_subscript_out_of_range;
    4978             :       } else {
    4979           0 :         *err_code = ec_pointer_outside_base_object;
    4980             :       }  /* if */
    4981           0 :       *err_severity = es_warning;

    4985             : #if DEBUG

    4987             :                       constant_1, constant_2, result, *err_code);
    4988             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    4989           0 :   release_local_constant(&offset);
    4990           0 : }  /* do_padd */

    4992             : 
    4993           0 : static a_boolean same_string_base_address_constants(a_constant_ptr  cp1,

    5016             : 
    5017           0 : void do_pdiff(a_constant        *constant_1,
    5018             :               a_constant        *constant_2,
    5019             :               a_constant        *result,
    5020             :               a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    5021             :               an_error_code     *err_code,
    5022             :               an_error_severity *err_severity)
    5023             : /*
    5024             : Do the pointer subtraction "pointer - pointer": pointer difference.
    5025             : constant_1 and constant_2 are the two pointer constants.  The result
    5026             : is returned in result.  If the operation cannot be folded to
    5027             : a constant (because the pointers do not point to the same object),
    5028             : *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.  *err_code and *err_severity are set
    5029             : to indicate any error/warning detected, or *err_code == ec_no_error
    5030             : if everything went fine.  Also handles address constants cast to an
    5031             : integral type, as in "(int)&x - (int)&x".
    5032             : */
    5033             : {
    5034           0 :   a_constant_ptr   offset_2 = local_constant(), offset_1 = local_constant();
    5035           0 :   char             *base_1, *base_2;
    5036           0 :   an_integer_value difference, size_intval;
    5037           0 :   a_type_ptr       object_type;
    5038           0 :   a_boolean        err, offset_1_is_signed, offset_2_is_signed;
    5039           0 :   a_boolean        cannot_fold = FALSE;
    5040             : 
    5041           0 :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    5042           0 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    5043             :   /* The two pointers must be in the same base object, or the operation
    5044             :      cannot be folded. */
    5045           0 :   base_1 = base_object(constant_1, &cannot_fold);
    5046           0 :   base_2 = base_object(constant_2, &cannot_fold);
    5047           0 :   if ((base_1 != base_2 &&
    5048           0 :        !same_string_base_address_constants(constant_1, constant_2)) ||
    5049             :       cannot_fold) {
    5050           0 :     if (cannot_fold) {
    5051             :       /* Nothing more to do. */
    5052             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5053           0 :     } else if (gnu_mode && constant_is_address_of_label(constant_1) &&

    5055             :       /* An exception is the difference of two label addresses in GNU mode. */
    5056           0 :       clear_constant(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_label_difference);
    5057           0 :       result->variant.label_difference.from_address =
    5058           0 :                                          alloc_shareable_constant(constant_2);
    5059           0 :       result->variant.label_difference.to_address =
    5060           0 :                                          alloc_shareable_constant(constant_1);

    5062           0 :     } else if ((gnu_mode || microsoft_mode) &&
    5063           0 :                constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(constant_2) &&

    5066           0 :                is_character_type(type_pointed_to(constant_1->type))) {
    5067             :       /* Also a "char *" address minus a "char *" zero.  Since the stride is 1,
    5068             :          the result is the first constant cast to the integral result type. */
    5069           0 :       copy_constant(constant_1, result);
    5070           0 :       implicit_cast(result, integer_type(targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind));
    5071             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5072             :     } else {
    5073           0 :       cannot_fold = TRUE;
    5074             :     }  /* if */
    5075             :   } else {
    5076             :     /* The pointers are in the same base object, so the difference of
    5077             :        their offsets can be taken. */
    5078           0 :     get_pointer_offset(constant_1, offset_1);
    5079           0 :     offset_1_is_signed = int_constant_is_signed(offset_1);
    5080           0 :     get_pointer_offset(constant_2, offset_2);
    5081           0 :     offset_2_is_signed = int_constant_is_signed(offset_2);
    5082           0 :     difference = offset_1->variant.integer_value;

    5084             :                                          offset_1_is_signed,
    5085           0 :                                          &offset_2->variant.integer_value,

    5087           0 :     if (!err) {
    5088             :       /* Divide the difference by the size of the objects pointed to.
    5089             :          The caller has already checked that the type pointed to is
    5090             :          not incomplete, so the size is not zero (except possibly
    5091             :          in gcc mode).  If the address constants have been cast to
    5092             :          integer, there is no scaling. */
    5093           0 :       if (!is_integral_type(constant_1->type)) {
    5094           0 :         a_targ_size_t  object_size;

    5096           0 :         object_type = skip_typerefs(object_type);

    5098           0 :           object_size = gcc_stride_size(object_type);

    5111           0 :     if (!err) {

    5113             :                             /*saturate_on_overflow=*/FALSE,
    5114             :                             err_code, err_severity);
    5115             :     } else {
    5116           0 :       *err_code = ec_integer_overflow;

    5123           0 :       fprintf(f_debug, "do_pdiff: did not fold\n");
    5124             :     } else {
    5125           0 :       db_binary_operation("pd", constant_1, constant_2, result, *err_code);
    5126             :     }  /* if */

    5135           0 : static void do_pcompare(a_constant            *constant_1,
    5136             :                         an_expr_operator_kind op,
    5137             :                         a_constant            *constant_2,
    5138             :                         a_constant            *result,
    5139             :                         a_boolean             *did_not_fold,
    5140             :                         an_error_code         *err_code,
    5141             :                         an_error_severity     *err_severity)
    5142             : /*
    5143             : Fold a relational operation on two pointer constants.  constant_1 and
    5144             : constant_2 are compared according to the indicated operator, and
    5145             : *result is set to an integer 0 or 1 for the result.  *err_code and
    5146             : *err_severity are set if there are warnings or errors, or
    5147             : *err_code == ec_no_error is there were no problems.  *did_not_fold is
    5148             : set if the operation cannot be folded.
    5149             : */
    5150             : {
    5151           0 :   a_constant_ptr offset_1 = local_constant(), offset_2 = local_constant();
    5152           0 :   char           *base_1, *base_2;
    5153           0 :   int            result_value = 0, cmp;
    5154           0 :   a_boolean      cannot_fold = FALSE;
    5155             : 
    5156           0 :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    5157           0 :   *err_severity = es_warning;
    5158           0 :   base_1 = base_object(constant_1, &cannot_fold);
    5159           0 :   base_2 = base_object(constant_2, &cannot_fold);
    5160           0 :   if (base_1 != base_2 || cannot_fold) {
    5161             :     /* The pointers are in different objects.  In C++11 and following,
    5162             :        equality comparisons of constant addresses are required to work in
    5163             :        the obvious fashion.  In earlier versions of the language, however,
    5164             :        we should not fold even equality comparisons:
    5165             :          int i, j;
    5166             :          if (&i != &j) { ... }  <--- probably different
    5167             :        However, that seems pointless, and could actually cause problems
    5168             :        (maybe a smart compiler puts i and j at the same address because
    5169             :        their lifetimes are disjoint). */
    5170           0 :     if (cannot_fold) {
    5171             :       /* The base object of at least one of the constants is not known for
    5172             :          sure: Do not attempt to fold the result. */
    5173           0 :     } else if (constexpr_enabled &&
    5174           0 :                (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_eq ||
    5175             :                 op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne)) {
    5176             :       /* Constant pointers to different objects compare unequal. */
    5177           0 :       result_value = (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne);
    5178           0 :       set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    5179           0 :       set_integer_value(&result->variant.integer_value,
    5180             :                         (a_host_large_integer)result_value);
    5181             :     } else {
    5182             :       /* Pre-C++11 or relational comparison (which cannot be folded, even
    5183             :          in C++11). */
    5184           0 :       cannot_fold = TRUE;
    5185           0 :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_eq ||
    5186             :           op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne) {
    5187             :         /* However, "&var != NULL" or "&var == NULL" can often be folded. */
    5188           0 :         a_variable_ptr var = NULL;
    5189           0 :         if (is_null_pointer_value(constant_2) &&
    5190           0 :             constant_1->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
    5191           0 :             constant_1->variant.address.kind ==
    5192             :                                           (an_address_base_kind)abk_variable) {
    5193           0 :           var = constant_1->variant.address.variant.variable;
    5194           0 :         } else if (is_null_pointer_value(constant_1) &&
    5195           0 :                    constant_2->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
    5196           0 :                    constant_2->variant.address.kind ==
    5197             :                                           (an_address_base_kind)abk_variable) {
    5198           0 :           var = constant_2->variant.address.variant.variable;
    5199             :         }  /* if */
    5200           0 :         if (var != NULL && variable_has_non_null_address(var)) {
    5201           0 :           cannot_fold = FALSE;
    5202           0 :           result_value = (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne);
    5203           0 :           set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    5204           0 :           set_integer_value(&result->variant.integer_value,
    5205             :                             (a_host_large_integer)result_value);
    5206             :         }  /* if */
    5207             :       }  /* if */
    5208             :     }  /* if */
    5209             :   } else {
    5210             :     /* The pointers are in the same base object, so they can be compared. */
    5211           0 :     get_pointer_offset(constant_1, offset_1);
    5212           0 :     get_pointer_offset(constant_2, offset_2);
    5213             :     /* Compare the offsets, then generate a result value. */
    5214           0 :     cmp = cmp_integer_constants(offset_1, offset_2);
    5215           0 :     switch (op) {
    5216           0 :       case eok_eq:  result_value = (cmp == 0); break;
    5217           0 :       case eok_ne:  result_value = (cmp != 0); break;
    5218           0 :       case eok_gt:  result_value = (cmp >  0); break;
    5219           0 :       case eok_lt:  result_value = (cmp <  0); break;
    5220           0 :       case eok_ge:  result_value = (cmp >= 0); break;
    5221           0 :       case eok_le:  result_value = (cmp <= 0); break;
    5222           0 :       default:      unexpected_condition_str("do_pcompare: bad operator");
    5223             :     }  /* switch */
    5224           0 :     set_constant_kind(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    5225           0 :     set_integer_value(&result->variant.integer_value,
    5226             :                       (a_host_large_integer)result_value);
    5227             :   }  /* if */
    5228             : #if DEBUG
    5229           0 :   if (debug_level  >= 5) {
    5230           0 :     if (cannot_fold) {
    5231           0 :       fprintf(f_debug, "do_pcompare: did not fold\n");
    5232             :     } else {
    5233           0 :       db_binary_operation(db_operator_names[op],
    5234             :                           constant_1, constant_2, result, *err_code);
    5235             :     }  /* if */
    5236             :   }  /* if */
    5237             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5238           0 :   release_local_constant(&offset_1);
    5239           0 :   release_local_constant(&offset_2);
    5240           0 :   *did_not_fold = cannot_fold;
    5241           0 : }  /* do_pcompare */
    5242             : 
    5243             : 
    5244           0 : static void do_pmcompare(a_constant            *constant_1,
    5245             :                          an_expr_operator_kind op,
    5246             :                          a_constant            *constant_2,
    5247             :                          a_constant            *result)
    5248             : /*
    5249             : Fold a relational operation on two pointer-to-member constants.
    5250             : constant_1 and constant_2 are compared according to the indicated operator,
    5251             : and *result is set to an integer 0 or 1 for the result.
    5252             : */
    5253             : {
    5254           0 :   int result_value = FALSE;
    5255             : 
    5256           0 :   if (constant_1->variant.ptr_to_member.casting_base_class ==
    5257           0 :                         constant_2->variant.ptr_to_member.casting_base_class &&
    5258           0 :       constant_1->variant.ptr_to_member.is_function_ptr ==

    5313           0 : static void binary_upc_threads_operation(
    5314             :                                   an_expr_operator_kind op,

    5318             :                                   a_constant            *result,
    5319             :                                   a_boolean             constant_context,
    5320             :                                   a_boolean             evaluated_context,
    5321             :                                   a_boolean             *did_not_fold,
    5322             :                                   a_boolean             *template_constant,
    5323             :                                   a_source_position     *err_pos)
    5324             : /*
    5325             : Attempt to fold an operation (op) on two constants (constant_1, constant_2),
    5326             : at least one of which is a UPC THREADS-based constant.  See binary_operation
    5327             : (below) for the meaning of the other parameters.  Operations on UPC THREADS-
    5328             : based constants are handled by converting them to integer constants, and
    5329             : then converting the result back to being THREADS-based if appropriate.

    5331             : {
    5332           0 :   a_constant_ptr  tmp = local_constant();
    5333             : 
    5334           0 :   check_assertion(upc_dynamic_threads());

    5336           0 :       constant_2->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_upc_threads) {
    5337             :     /* E.g., THREADS/THREADS. */

    5339             :        E.g., "3*THREADS/THREADS" cannot be folded to "3" because "3*THREADS"
    5340             :        may be an overflow when THREADS is statically specified. */
    5341           0 :     *did_not_fold = TRUE;
    5342             :   } else {
    5343           0 :     a_constant_ptr  nonthread_constant;

    5400             : 
    5401             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
    5402           0 : static void decompose_vector_binary_operation(an_expr_operator_kind op,

    5406             :                                           a_constant        *result,
    5407             :                                           a_boolean         constant_context,
    5408             :                                           a_boolean         evaluated_context,
    5409             :                                           a_boolean         *did_not_fold,
    5410             :                                           a_boolean         *template_constant,
    5411             :                                           an_error_code     *error_detected,
    5412             :                                           a_source_position *err_pos)
    5413             : /*
    5414             : Called by binary_operation when the result type is a GNU vector type to
    5415             : recursively perform the specified operation on each of the vector's
    5416             : elements.  Produces in *result a vector ck_aggregate constant with the
    5417             : number of elements specified by the vector type, allocating the element
    5418             : constants in the current memory region.  See binary_operation for a full
    5419             : description of the parameters.
    5420             : */
    5421             : {
    5422           0 :   a_constant_ptr opnd1_elem;
    5423           0 :   a_constant_ptr opnd2_elem;

    5427           0 :   a_boolean      opnd2_local_constant = FALSE;
    5428           0 :   a_boolean      local_not_folded = FALSE;
    5429           0 :   sizeof_t       num_result_elements;
    5430           0 :   a_type_ptr     result_elem_type;

    5432             : 
    5433           0 :   check_assertion(result_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_vector);
    5434           0 :   result_elem_type = result_type->variant.vector.element_type;
    5435           0 :   num_result_elements = result_type->size / result_elem_type->size;
    5436             :   /* Either of the operands may be a scalar or a vector.  If the operand
    5437             :      is an aggregate (vector), use the first element constant as the

    5440           0 :     opnd1_elem_from_aggr = TRUE;

    5504             : 
    5505      153901 : void binary_operation(an_expr_operator_kind op,
    5506             :                       a_constant            *constant_1,
    5507             :                       a_constant            *constant_2,
    5508             :                       a_type_ptr            result_type,
    5509             :                       a_constant            *result,
    5510             :                       a_boolean             constant_context,
    5511             :                       a_boolean             evaluated_context,
    5512             :                       a_boolean             *did_not_fold,
    5513             :                       a_boolean             *template_constant,
    5514             :                       an_error_code         *error_detected,
    5515             :                       a_source_position     *err_pos)
    5516             : /*
    5517             : Fold a two-operand constant operation.  op indicates the operation,
    5518             : and constant_1 and constant_2 are the operands.  result_type indicates
    5519             : the desired result type.  The result constant is placed in *result.
    5520             : If constant_context is FALSE, this operation is being evaluated as
    5521             : part of a nonconstant expression, so any error is reduced to a
    5522             : warning and *did_not_fold is returned TRUE.  If evaluated_context
    5523             : is FALSE, this operation is being done in a not-evaluated context
    5524             : (e.g., a sizeof or a dead branch of a "?" operator), so any error
    5525             : is thrown away and *did_not_fold is returned TRUE. *did_not_fold is
    5526             : also returned TRUE if the operation could not be folded for any other
    5527             : reason (*template_constant is returned TRUE if the reason is that
    5528             : the constant is a template parameter constant).  If error_detected is
    5529             : non-NULL, set *error_detected to the code for any error detected, and
    5530             : do not issue the diagnostic, or set it to ec_no_error if there was no
    5531             : error.  *err_pos is used as the position for any diagnostics issued.
    5532             : */
    5533             : {
    5534      153901 :   an_error_code     err_code;
    5535      153901 :   an_error_severity err_severity;
    5536      153901 :   a_boolean         depends_on_fp_mode = FALSE;
    5537             : 
    5538      153901 :   db_enter(5, "binary_operation");
    5539             : 
    5540      153901 :   *did_not_fold = FALSE;
    5541      153901 :   *template_constant = FALSE;
    5542      153901 :   if (error_detected != NULL) *error_detected = ec_no_error;
    5543      153901 :   err_code = ec_no_error;
    5544      153901 :   err_severity = es_warning;
    5545             : 
    5546      153901 :   if (is_error_constant(constant_1) || is_error_constant(constant_2)) {

    5984        4908 : static a_boolean fold_expr(an_expr_node_ptr             expr,
    5985             :                            a_constant                   *result_con)
    5986             : /*
    5987             : Attempt to fold the expression "expr" to a constant as part of a
    5988             : constexpr evaluation, by substituting argument constant values for
    5989             : parameters.  If the expression folds to a constant, place the constant
    5990             : in *result_con and return TRUE; otherwise, return FALSE.  If the
    5991             : expression is a glvalue, do not fold (see fold_glvalue_expr instead).
    5992             : */
    5993             : {
    5994        4908 :   a_boolean    folded;
    5995             : 
    5996        4908 :   if (is_glvalue_node(expr)) {
    5997             :     /* Only fold expressions that produce prvalue results. */
    5998             :     folded = FALSE;
    5999             :   } else {
    6000        4908 :     a_diag_list  diag_list;
    6001        4908 :     clear_diag_list(&diag_list);
    6002        4908 :     folded = interpret_expr(expr, /*force_rvalue=*/FALSE, result_con,
    6003             :                             &diag_list);
    6004        4908 :     discard_more_info_list(&diag_list);
    6005             :   }  /* if */
    6006        4908 :   return folded;
    6007             : }  /* fold_expr */
    6008             : 
    6009             : 
    6010        1820 : static a_boolean fold_glvalue_expr(an_expr_node_ptr             expr,
    6011             :                                    a_constant                   *result_con)
    6012             : /*
    6013             : Attempt to fold the glvalue expression "expr" to a constant address as
    6014             : part of constexpr evaluation, by substituting argument constant values for
    6015             : parameters.  If the expression folds to a constant address, place the
    6016             : constant in *result_con and return TRUE; otherwise, return FALSE.  If
    6017             : the expression is not a glvalue, do not fold (see fold_expr instead).
    6018             : */

    6021             :

    6023        1820 :   if (!is_glvalue_node(expr)) {
    6024             :     /* Do not fold expressions that are not glvalues. */
    6025             :     folded = FALSE;
    6026             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
    6027             :   } else if (il_lowering_underway) {
    6028             :     /* Don't attempt expression folding during lowering. */
    6029             :     folded = FALSE;
    6030             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING */
    6031             :   } else {
    6032        1820 :     a_diag_list  diag_list;
    6033        1820 :     clear_diag_list(&diag_list);

    6037             :       /* The interpreter will produce a reference constant when folding a
    6038             :          glvalue.  Make it a pointer constant instead. */

    6040           0 :       result_con->type = make_pointer_type(tpt);

    6042        1820 :     discard_more_info_list(&diag_list);
    6043             :   }  /* if */

    6048           2 : static void accum_field_offset(a_constant_ptr        total_offset,

    6086             : 
    6087             : 
    6088           2 : a_boolean fold_field_selection(a_constant  *constant_1,
    6089             :                                a_field_ptr field,
    6090             :                                a_type_ptr  result_type,
    6091             :                                a_constant  *result)
    6092             : /*
    6093             : Fold a constant field selection operation.  constant_1 is the pointer to the
    6094             : struct/union; field is the selected field.  The result type (pointer to the
    6095             : field type) is given by result_type.  The result is put in *result.
    6096             : Return TRUE if the selection can be folded, FALSE if not (the latter is
    6097             : returned for template-dependent cases).  This folding operation is not done
    6098             : through the usual interface because a field cannot be passed as a constant.
    6099             : */
    6100             : {
    6101           2 :   a_boolean      is_constant = TRUE;
    6102           2 :   a_constant_ptr offset = local_constant();
    6103           2 :   a_boolean      err;

    6147          64 : static a_boolean constant_padd_or_subscript(

    6153             : /*

    6155             : operation.  If its result (eok_padd, eok_psubtract) or address (lvalue

    6248        3361 : static a_boolean constant_glvalue_address_full(

    6253             :                              a_boolean                     *template_constant)
    6254             : /*
    6255             : expr is a glvalue expression.  If it has a constant address, put that
    6256             : address in *con and return TRUE.  Otherwise, return FALSE.  address_escapes is
    6257             : TRUE if the address might escape from its immediate context and get saved
    6258             : somewhere (if in doubt, the safe value is TRUE).  options contains a
    6259             : set of additional options.  *template_constant is returned TRUE if the
    6260             : constant is template-dependent.  If template_constant is NULL, a
    6261             : template-dependent constant is labeled as such at this level.  Passing
    6262             : it in as non-NULL is a signal that the caller would prefer to handle

    7105           0 : static a_boolean add_offset_of_accessed_member(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    7106             :                                                a_constant_ptr     offset,
    7107             :                                                a_source_position  *pos)
    7108             : /*
    7109             : expr represents the element access operation of a builtin offsetof operator
    7110             : (or a part thereof in multilevel cases).  Add to *offset the offset implied
    7111             : by this access operation.  Multilevel cases (e.g., "offsetof(T, x[3].y)") are
    7112             : handled through recursion.  Error cases can occur when accessing a member of a
    7113             : virtual base, or when dealing with subscripts that are too large (overflow).
    7114             : In such cases, return FALSE and issue a diagnostic at the given position (if
    7115             : it is non-NULL).  Otherwise, return TRUE.
    7116             : */
    7117             : {
    7118           0 :   a_boolean         okay = TRUE, ovflo = FALSE;
    7119           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr  args;
    7120           0 :   an_integer_value  int_val;
    7121             : 
    7122             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear in these generated operations. */
    7123           0 :   if (is_constant_node(expr)) {
    7124             :     /* Presumably the null constant that is the root of the tree. */
    7125           0 :     check_assertion(is_false_constant(node_constant(expr)));
    7126           0 :     goto done;
    7127             :   } else {
    7128           0 :     check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr));
    7129             :     /* Do a recursive call to process the bottom of the tree first. */

    7131           0 :     okay = add_offset_of_accessed_member(args, offset, pos);
    7132             :   }  /* if */

    7134           0 :     case eok_dot_field:

    7137           0 :       accum_field_offset(offset, node_field(args->next),

    7139           0 :       break;
    7140           0 :     case eok_subscript:

    7143           0 :         a_boolean        did_not_fold;
    7144           0 :         check_assertion(is_constant_node(arg2));

    7146             :            either order, in offsetof the subscript is always the second

    7240           0 : static void fold_offsetof(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    7241             :                           a_constant_ptr     constant,
    7242             :                           a_boolean          maintain_expression,
    7243             :                           a_source_position  *pos,
    7244             :                           a_boolean          *not_a_constant)
    7245             : /*
    7246             : expr is an enk_builtin_operation node for a __builtin_offsetof operation
    7247             : (currently only accepted in some GNU modes).  If any of the operands is
    7248             : template-dependent, store a ck_template_param constant in *constant (the
    7249             : constant will be of the tpck_expression variant and will point to the given
    7250             : expression).  Otherwise, if the second operand contains a nonconstant
    7251             : subscript, set *not_a_constant to TRUE and leave *constant unchanged.  In all
    7252             : other cases, store the integer value of the offset being represented in
    7253             : *constant (if maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the
    7254             : returned constant will be set as well).  If a constant is returned through
    7255             : *constant, *not_a_constant is set to FALSE.  If pos is non-NULL, diagnostics
    7256             : are issued at the position it indicates.
    7257             : */
    7258             : {
    7259           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg1 = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands,

    7261             : 
    7262             :   /* Start with the assumption that a constant will be produced. */
    7263           0 :   *not_a_constant = FALSE;
    7264             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear here, since the construct is generated. */

    7278             :                                   targ_size_t_int_kind);

    7296           0 : static void fold_is_base_of(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,

    7299             : /*

    7302             : boolean constant will have value "true" if the operand types are (possibly
    7303             : qualified) class types the first of which is a base class of the second one;
    7304             : otherwise, the constant will have value "false".  If either of the operand
    7305             : types is dependent, store a ck_template_param constant in *constant.  The
    7306             : constant will be of the tpck_expression variant and will point to the given

    7345           0 : static void fold_is_convertible_to(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    7346             :                                    a_constant_ptr     constant,
    7347             :                                    a_boolean          maintain_expression)
    7348             : /*
    7349             : expr is an enk_builtin_operation node for an __is_convertible_to operation,
    7350             : which implements the C++ TR1 is_convertible type relationship predicate
    7351             : (see [lib.meta.rel]).  Store a boolean constant in *constant whose value
    7352             : is "true" if the first operand type is "implicitly convertible to" the
    7353             : second operand type.  If either of the operand types is dependent, store
    7354             : a ck_template_param constant in *constant.  The constant will be of the
    7355             : tpck_expression variant and will point to the given expression.
    7356             : If maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the returned
    7357             : constant will be set as well.
    7358             : */
    7359             : {
    7360           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg1 = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands,
    7361           0 :                     arg2 = arg1->next;
    7362           0 :   a_type_ptr        type1, type2;
    7363             : 
    7364             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear here, since the construct is generated. */
    7365           0 :   check_assertion(arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL && arg2->next == NULL &&
    7366             :                   arg1->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_type_operand &&
    7367             :                   arg2->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_type_operand);
    7368           0 :   type1 = arg1->variant.type_operand.type;
    7369           0 :   type2 = arg2->variant.type_operand.type;
    7370           0 :   if (is_template_dependent_type(type1) ||
    7371           0 :       is_template_dependent_type(type2)) {
    7372           0 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param);
    7373           0 :     set_template_param_constant_kind(
    7374             :                    constant, (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_expression);
    7375           0 :     constant->variant.template_param.variant.expr = expr;
    7376             :   } else {
    7377           0 :     a_boolean  result;
    7378           0 :     if (microsoft_mode) {
    7379             :       a_boolean  force_array_to_reference = FALSE;
    7380             :       if (microsoft_version < 1800) {
    7381             :         a_boolean   is_rvalue_ref1 = is_rvalue_reference_type(type1), 
    7382             :                     is_rvalue_ref2 = is_rvalue_reference_type(type2);
    7383             :         /* MSVC 11 and earlier appear to treat rvalue reference types a little
    7384             :            strangely.  If both the source and destination type are rvalue
    7385             :            reference types, the result is always false.  Otherwise, an rvalue
    7386             :            reference on the source type appears to be treated like an lvalue
    7387             :            reference, and an rvalue reference on the destination type is
    7388             :            treated as the underlying type without a reference. */
    7389             :         if (is_rvalue_ref1 && is_rvalue_ref2) {
    7390             :           result = FALSE;
    7391             :           goto result_known;
    7392             :         } else if (is_rvalue_ref1) {
    7393             :           type1 = make_reference_type(type_pointed_to(type1));
    7394             :         } else if (is_rvalue_ref2 && !is_reference_type(type1)) {
    7395             :           type2 = type_pointed_to(type2);
    7396             :         }  /* if */
    7397             :       }  /* if */
    7398             :       if (microsoft_version < 1900 || (microsoft_version == 1900 &&
    7399             :                                        microsoft_build_number <= 22129)) {
    7400             :         /* Prior to a recent build of MSVC "19.00", Microsoft implicitly added
    7401             :            an "lvalue reference" layer on top of array types. */
    7402             :         force_array_to_reference = TRUE;
    7403             :       }  /* if*/
    7404             :       if (is_function_type(type1) ||
    7405             :           (force_array_to_reference && is_array_type(type1))) {
    7406             :         /* Microsoft appears to treat conversions from functions and arrays as
    7407             :            conversions from lvalue references to those types. */
    7408             :         type1 = make_reference_type(type1);
    7409             :       }  /* if */
    7410             :       if (force_array_to_reference && is_array_type(type2)) {
    7411             :         /* Microsoft appears to treat a conversion to an array type as a
    7412             :            conversion to an lvalue reference to that array type. */
    7413             :         type2 = make_reference_type(type2);
    7414             :       } else if (is_void_type(type2) && microsoft_version < 1800) {
    7415             :         /* MSVC++ prior to version 12 disallowed even void->void conversions
    7416             :            (which compute_is_convertible allows). */
    7417             :         result = FALSE;
    7418             :         goto result_known;
    7419             :       }  /* if */       
    7420             :     }  /* if */
    7421           0 :     result = compute_is_convertible(type1, type2);
    7422           0 : result_known:
    7423           0 :     arg1->type_definition_needed = TRUE;
    7424           0 :     arg2->type_definition_needed = TRUE;
    7425           0 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    7426           0 :     set_integer_value(&constant->variant.integer_value,
    7427             :                       (a_host_large_integer)result);
    7428           0 :     if (maintain_expression) constant->expr = expr;
    7429             :   }  /* if */
    7430           0 :   constant->type = expr->type;
    7431           0 : }  /* fold_is_convertible_to */
    7432             : 
    7433             : 
    7434          25 : static void fold_is_constructible(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    7435             :                                   a_constant_ptr     constant,
    7436             :                                   a_boolean          maintain_expression)
    7437             : /*
    7438             : expr is an enk_builtin_operation node for an __is_constructible,
    7439             : __is_nothrow_constructible, or __is_trivially_constructible operation.  Store
    7440             : a boolean constant in *constant whose value is "true" if the following
    7441             : variable definition would be well-formed for some invented variable t:
    7442             :       T t(create<Args>()...);
    7443             : with
    7444             :       template<class T>
    7445             :         typename add_rvalue_reference<T>::type create();
    7446             : If the built-in operation kind is bok_is_nothrow_constructible, the definition
    7447             : must be known not to throw any exceptions.  If the built-in operation kind is
    7448             : bok_is_trivially_constructible, the definition must be known not to involve a
    7449             : non-trivial (copy) construction.  If any of the operand types is dependent,
    7450             : store a ck_template_param constant in *constant.  The constant will be of the
    7451             : tpck_expression variant and will point to the given expression.
    7452             : If maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the returned
    7453             : constant will be set as well.
    7454             : */
    7455             : {
    7456          25 :   a_builtin_operation_kind
    7457          25 :                     kind = expr->variant.builtin_operation.kind;
    7458          25 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg1 = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands,
    7459             :                     argn;
    7460          25 :   a_type_ptr        type1, typen;
    7461          25 :   a_boolean         dependent = FALSE, result;
    7462             : 
    7463             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear here, since the construct is generated. */
    7464          25 :   check_assertion(arg1 != NULL && is_type_node(arg1));
    7465          25 :   type1 = type_operand_type(arg1);
    7466          25 :   if (is_template_dependent_type(type1)) {
    7467             :     dependent = TRUE;
    7468             :   } else {
    7469          49 :     for (argn = arg1->next; argn != NULL; argn = argn->next) {
    7470          24 :       check_assertion(is_type_node(argn));
    7471          24 :       typen = type_operand_type(argn);
    7472          24 :       if (is_template_dependent_type(typen)) {
    7473             :         dependent = TRUE;
    7474             :         break;
    7475             :       }  /* if */
    7476             :     }  /* for */
    7477             :   }  /* if */
    7478          25 :   if (dependent) {
    7479             :     /* One or more of the types is dependent, so the result is still
    7480             :        unknown. */
    7481           0 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param);
    7482           0 :     set_template_param_constant_kind(
    7483             :                    constant, (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_expression);
    7484           0 :     constant->variant.template_param.variant.expr = expr;
    7485             :   } else {
    7486          25 :     result = compute_is_constructible(kind, type1, arg1->next);
    7487          25 :     if (result && !microsoft_mode) {
    7488          25 :       a_builtin_operation_kind  dtor_kind;
    7489          25 :       if (kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_trivially_constructible) {
    7490             :         dtor_kind = (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_trivially_destructible;
    7491          25 :       } else if (kind ==
    7492             :                      (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_nothrow_constructible) {
    7493             :         dtor_kind = (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_nothrow_destructible;
    7494             :       } else {
    7495          25 :         dtor_kind = (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_destructible;
    7496             :       }  /* if */
    7497          25 :       result = compute_is_destructible(dtor_kind, type1);
    7498             :     }  /* if */
    7499          25 :     arg1->type_definition_needed = TRUE;
    7500          49 :     for (argn = arg1->next; argn != NULL; argn = argn->next) {
    7501          24 :       check_assertion(is_type_node(argn));
    7502          24 :       argn->type_definition_needed = TRUE;
    7503             :     }  /* for */
    7504          25 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    7505          25 :     set_integer_value(&constant->variant.integer_value,
    7506             :                       (a_host_large_integer)result);
    7507          25 :     if (maintain_expression) constant->expr = expr;
    7508             :   }  /* if */
    7509          25 :   constant->type = expr->type;
    7510          25 : }  /* fold_is_constructible */
    7511             : 
    7512             : 
    7513           0 : static void fold_is_destructible(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    7514             :                                  a_constant_ptr     constant,
    7515             :                                  a_boolean          maintain_expression)
    7516             : /*
    7517             : expr is an enk_builtin_operation node for an __is_destructible,
    7518             : __is_nothrow_destructible, or __is_trivially_assignable operation.  Store a
    7519             : boolean constant in *constant whose value is "true" if
    7520             :       declval<U&>().~U()
    7521             : is well-formed, where U is the argument type minus any top-level "array of"
    7522             : layers and the declval template is declared as follows:
    7523             :       template<class T>
    7524             :         typename add_rvalue_reference<T>::type declval() noexcept;
    7525             : In the case of __is_nothrow_destructible, a true result also means it is known
    7526             : that no exception is thrown for the destruction, and in the case of
    7527             : __is_trivially_destructible the destructor is trivial.  If any of the operand
    7528             : types is dependent, store a ck_template_param constant in *constant.  The
    7529             : constant will be of the tpck_expression variant and will point to the given
    7530             : expression.  If maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the
    7531             : returned constant will be set as well.
    7532             : */
    7533             : {
    7534           0 :   a_builtin_operation_kind
    7535           0 :                     kind = expr->variant.builtin_operation.kind;
    7536           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg1 = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands;
    7537           0 :   a_type_ptr        type1;
    7538             : 
    7539             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear here, since the construct is generated. */
    7540           0 :   check_assertion(arg1 != NULL && is_type_node(arg1));
    7541           0 :   type1 = type_operand_type(arg1);
    7542           0 :   if (is_template_dependent_type(type1)) {
    7543             :     /* The type is dependent, so the result is still unknown. */
    7544           0 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param);

    7546             :                    constant, (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_expression);
    7547           0 :     constant->variant.template_param.variant.expr = expr;
    7548             :   } else {
    7549           0 :     a_boolean  result = compute_is_destructible(kind, type1);

    7552           0 :     set_integer_value(&constant->variant.integer_value,
    7553             :                       (a_host_large_integer)result);

    7559             : 
    7560          24 : static void fold_is_assignable(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    7561             :                                a_constant_ptr     constant,
    7562             :                                a_boolean          maintain_expression)
    7563             : /*
    7564             : expr is an enk_builtin_operation node for an __is_nothrow_assignable or
    7565             : __is_trivially_assignable operation.  Store a boolean constant in *constant
    7566             : whose value is "true" if
    7567             :       declval<T>() = declval<U>()
    7568             : with
    7569             :       template<class T>
    7570             :         typename add_rvalue_reference<T>::type declval() noexcept;
    7571             : is well-formed, and it is known no exception is thrown for the assignment (for
    7572             : the __is_nothrow_assignable case) or all calls involved are to trivial special
    7573             : members (in the __is_trivially_assignable case).  If any of the operand types
    7574             : is dependent, store a ck_template_param constant in *constant.  The constant
    7575             : will be of the tpck_expression variant and will point to the given expression.
    7576             : If maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the returned
    7577             : constant will be set as well.
    7578             : */
    7579             : {
    7580          24 :   a_builtin_operation_kind
    7581          24 :                     kind = expr->variant.builtin_operation.kind;
    7582          24 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg1 = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands, arg2;
    7583          24 :   a_type_ptr        type1, type2;
    7584             : 
    7585             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear here, since the construct is generated. */

    7587          24 :   arg2 = arg1->next;
    7588          24 :   check_assertion(arg2 != NULL && is_type_node(arg2));

    7590          24 :   type2 = type_operand_type(arg2);
    7591          24 :   if (is_template_dependent_type(type1) || is_template_dependent_type(type2)) {
    7592             :     /* One or more of the types is dependent, so the result is still
    7593             :        unknown. */
    7594           0 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param);

    7596             :                    constant, (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_expression);

    7610             : 
    7611           0 : static a_boolean compute_has_nothrow_assign(a_type_ptr  class_type)
    7612             : /*
    7613             : Return TRUE if (and only if) this class' copy assignment operators are known
    7614             : not to throw exceptions.  This can be used to determine the value of the type
    7615             : trait pseudo-function __has_nothrow_assign, but in Microsoft mode, additional
    7616             : checking is needed (see microsoft_has_assign_predicate). 
    7617             : */
    7618             : {
    7619           0 :   a_field_ptr       fp;
    7620           0 :   a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
    7621           0 :   a_type_ptr        tp;
    7622           0 :   a_symbol_ptr      sym;
    7623           0 :   a_boolean         is_list;
    7624           0 :   a_boolean         result = TRUE;
    7625             : 
    7626             :   /* First examine any copy assignment operators. */
    7627           0 :   sym = class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(class_type))->assignment_operator;

    7630           0 :                found_nonthrowing_copy_assign = FALSE;

    7632           0 :       is_list = TRUE;
    7633           0 :       sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    7634             :     } else {
    7635           0 :       is_list = FALSE;
    7636             :     }  /* if */

    7641           0 :         a_routine_ptr         rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;

    7643           0 :             is_assignment_operator_for_copy(
    7644             :                                   sym, /*move_assign_okay=*/FALSE, &ref_param,
    7645             :                                   &qualifiers, &is_base_class_match)) {
    7646           0 :           found_copy_assign = TRUE;
    7647           0 :           if (microsoft_mode && microsoft_version >= 1800 && rp->is_deleted) {
    7648             :             /* MSVC doesn't consider deleted operators. */
    7649           0 :           } else if (is_non_throwing_routine(rp)) {
    7650             :             /* This copy assignment operator is known not to throw exceptions:
    7651             :                Continue checking other operators (if any). */
    7652             :             found_nonthrowing_copy_assign = TRUE;
    7653             :           } else {
    7654             :             /* A throwing copy assignment operator. */
    7655             :             break;
    7656             :           }  /*if */
    7657             :         }  /* if */
    7658             :       }  /* if */

    7660           0 :     if (found_copy_assign) {

    7662             :          sym points to the first one encountered. */
    7663           0 :       result = sym == NULL && found_nonthrowing_copy_assign;
    7664           0 :       goto done;
    7665             :     }  /* if */
    7666             :   }  /* if */
    7667             :   /* The copy assignment operator is generated: Look through the fields and
    7668             :      direct base classes to see if any of them make the result FALSE. */
    7669           0 :   fp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    7670           0 :   for (; fp != NULL; fp = fp->next) {
    7671           0 :     if (fp->compiler_generated && !fp->is_anonymous_parent_object) {
    7672             :       /* Ignore fields generated by prelowering. */
    7673           0 :       continue;
    7674             :     }  /* if */
    7675           0 :     tp = skip_array_types(fp->type);
    7676           0 :     tp = skip_typerefs(tp);
    7677           0 :     if (is_immediate_class_type(tp) && !compute_has_nothrow_assign(tp)) {
    7678           0 :       result = FALSE;
    7679           0 :       goto done;
    7680             :     }  /* if */
    7681             :   }  /* for */
    7682           0 :   bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
    7683           0 :   for (; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {

    7685           0 :       tp = skip_typerefs(bcp->type);

    7687           0 :         result = FALSE;
    7688           0 :         goto done;
    7689             :       }  /* if */
    7690             :     }  /* if */

    7692           0 : done:

    7695             : 
    7696             : 
    7697           0 : static a_boolean compute_has_nothrow_copy(a_type_ptr  class_type)
    7698             : /*
    7699             : Return TRUE if (and only if) this class' copy constructors are known not to
    7700             : throw exceptions.  This can be used to determine the value of the type trait
    7701             : pseudo-function __has_nothrow_copy, but in Microsoft mode, additional checking
    7702             : is needed (see microsoft_has_copy_predicate). 
    7703             : */
    7704             : {
    7705           0 :   a_field_ptr       fp;
    7706           0 :   a_base_class_ptr  bcp;
    7707           0 :   a_type_ptr        tp;
    7708           0 :   a_symbol_ptr      sym;
    7709           0 :   a_boolean         is_list;
    7710           0 :   a_boolean         result = TRUE;
    7711             : 
    7712             :   /* First examine any copy constructors. */
    7713           0 :   sym = class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(class_type))->constructor;

    7715           0 :     a_boolean  found_copy_ctor = FALSE;

    7718           0 :       sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;

    7720           0 :       is_list = FALSE;
    7721             :     }  /* if */

    7723           0 :       if (symbol_is(sym, sk_member_function)) {
    7724           0 :         a_routine_ptr  rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;

    7726           0 :         if (!rp->compiler_generated &&
    7727           0 :             is_copy_constructor_type(rtp, class_type,

    7729             :                                      /*include_move_ctors=*/FALSE,

    7731           0 :           found_copy_ctor = TRUE;

    7733             :             /* This copy constructor is known not to throw exceptions:
    7734             :                Continue checking other constructors (if any). */
    7735           0 :           } else {
    7736             :             /* A throwing copy constructor. */
    7737             :             break;
    7738             :           }  /*if */
    7739             :         }  /* if */
    7740             :       }  /* if */

    7746           0 :       goto done;
    7747             :     }  /* if */
    7748             :   }  /* if */
    7749             :   /* The copy constructor is generated: Look through the fields and direct
    7750             :      base classes to see if any of them make the result FALSE. */
    7751           0 :   fp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    7752           0 :   for (; fp != NULL; fp = fp->next) {
    7753           0 :     if (fp->compiler_generated && !fp->is_anonymous_parent_object) {
    7754             :       /* Ignore fields generated by prelowering. */
    7755           0 :       continue;
    7756             :     }  /* if */
    7757           0 :     tp = skip_array_types(fp->type);
    7758           0 :     tp = skip_typerefs(tp);
    7759           0 :     if (is_immediate_class_type(tp) && !compute_has_nothrow_copy(tp)) {
    7760           0 :       result = FALSE;
    7761           0 :       goto done;
    7762             :     }  /* if */
    7763             :   }  /* for */
    7764           0 :   bcp = base_classes_of(class_type);
    7765           0 :   for (; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    7766           0 :     if (bcp->direct) {
    7767           0 :       tp = skip_typerefs(bcp->type);

    7769           0 :         result = FALSE;

    7774           0 : done:
    7775           0 :   return result;
    7776             : }  /*  compute_has_nothrow_copy */
    7777             : 
    7778             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7779             : 
    7780             : static a_boolean microsoft_has_assign_predicate(a_type_ptr                type,
    7781             :                                                 a_builtin_operation_kind  kind)
    7782             : /*
    7783             : Determine the value of the __has_assign or __has_nothrow_assign pseudo-function
    7784             : (as indicated by kind) applied to the given type in Microsoft mode.
    7785             : Ordinarily, the result for __has_nothrow_assign is determined by a call to
    7786             : compute_has_nothrow_assign, but in Microsoft mode, the result can depend on
    7787             : the order of declaration of the assignment operators.
    7788             : */
    7789             : {
    7790             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
    7791             :                 cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(type);
    7792             :   a_symbol_ptr  sym = cssp->assignment_operator;
    7793             :   a_boolean     is_list = FALSE, result = FALSE, found_copy_assign = FALSE;
    7794             : 
    7795             :   if (sym != NULL) {
    7796             :     if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_overloaded_function) {
    7797             :       is_list = TRUE;
    7798             :       sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    7799             :     }  /* if */
    7800             :     for (; sym != NULL; sym = is_list ? sym->next : NULL) {
    7801             :       if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function) {
    7802             :         a_type_qualifier_set  qualifiers;
    7803             :         a_boolean             ref_param, is_base_class_match;
    7804             :         if (is_assignment_operator_for_copy(
    7805             :                     sym, /*move_assign_okay=*/FALSE, &ref_param,
    7806             :                     &qualifiers, &is_base_class_match)) {
    7807             :           a_routine_ptr  rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    7808             :           if (kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_has_assign) {
    7809             :             /* __has_assign returns true for any user-declared or nontrivial
    7810             :                copy assignment (MSVC++ does not currently support defaulted
    7811             :                assignment operators; we treat them like any other user-declared
    7812             :                operators in that respect). */
    7813             :             found_copy_assign = TRUE;
    7814             :             if (!rp->compiler_generated || !rp->is_trivial_copy_function) {
    7815             :               result = TRUE;
    7816             :               break;
    7817             :             }  /* if */
    7818             :           } else if (!rp->compiler_generated) {
    7819             :             /* __has_nothrow_assign: Return TRUE if the copy assignment
    7820             :                operators are declared with "throw()" or a "nothrow"
    7821             :                attribute. */
    7822             :             found_copy_assign = TRUE;
    7823             :             result = is_non_throwing_routine(rp);
    7824             :             /* Microsoft compilers only consider the first declared copy
    7825             :                assignment operator.  Since we store those operators in reverse
    7826             :                order of declaration, continue the loop in case another such
    7827             :                operator appears on the list. */
    7828             :           }  /* if */
    7829             :         }  /* if */
    7830             :       }  /* if */
    7831             :     }  /* for */
    7832             :   }  /* if */
    7833             :   if (!found_copy_assign &&
    7834             :       kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_has_nothrow_assign) {
    7835             :     /* If no copy assignment operator was found in the class, return the
    7836             :        normal value (which is independent of the declaration order of, e.g.,
    7837             :        operator= in base classes). */
    7838             :     result = compute_has_nothrow_assign(type);
    7839             :   }  /* if */
    7840             :   return result;
    7841             : }  /* microsoft_has_assign_predicate */
    7842             : 
    7843             : 
    7844             : static a_boolean microsoft_has_copy_predicate(a_type_ptr                type,
    7845             :                                               a_builtin_operation_kind  kind)
    7846             : /*
    7847             : Determine the value of the __has_copy or __has_nothrow_copy pseudo-function
    7848             : (as indicated by kind) applied to the given type in Microsoft mode.
    7849             : Ordinarily, the result for __has_nothrow_copy is determined by a call to
    7850             : compute_has_nothrow_copy, but in Microsoft mode, the result can depend on the
    7851             : order of declaration of the constructors.
    7852             : */
    7853             : {
    7854             :   a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
    7855             :                 cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(type);
    7856             :   a_symbol_ptr  sym = cssp->constructor;
    7857             :   a_boolean     is_list = FALSE, result = FALSE, found_copy_ctor = FALSE;
    7858             : 
    7859             :   if (sym != NULL) {
    7860             :     if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_overloaded_function) {
    7861             :       is_list = TRUE;
    7862             :       sym = sym->variant.overloaded_function.symbols;
    7863             :     }  /* if */
    7864             :     for (; sym != NULL; sym = is_list ? sym->next : NULL) {
    7865             :       if (sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function) {
    7866             :         a_routine_ptr  rp = sym->variant.routine.ptr;
    7867             :         a_type_ptr     rtp = skip_typerefs(rp->type);
    7868             :         if (is_copy_constructor_type(rtp, type, (a_type_qualifier_set *)NULL,
    7869             :                                      /*include_move_ctors=*/FALSE,
    7870             :                                      /*is_declarative_context=*/TRUE)) {
    7871             :           if (kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_has_copy) {
    7872             :             /* __has_copy returns true for any user-declared or nontrivial
    7873             :                copy constructor (MSVC++ does not currently support defaulted
    7874             :                copy constructors; we treat them like any other user-declared
    7875             :                constructors in that respect). */
    7876             :             found_copy_ctor = TRUE;
    7877             :             if (!rp->compiler_generated || !rp->is_trivial_copy_function) {
    7878             :               result = TRUE;
    7879             :               break;
    7880             :             }  /* if */
    7881             :           } else if (!rp->compiler_generated) {
    7882             :             /* __has_nothrow_copy: Return TRUE if the copy constructors are
    7883             :                declared with "throw()" or a "nothrow" attribute. */
    7884             :             found_copy_ctor = TRUE;
    7885             :             result = is_non_throwing_routine(rp);
    7886             :             /* Microsoft compilers only consider the first declared copy
    7887             :                constructor.  Since we store the constructors in reverse order
    7888             :                of declaration, continue the loop in case another copy
    7889             :                constructor appears on the list. */
    7890             :           }  /* if */
    7891             :         }  /* if */
    7892             :       }  /* if */
    7893             :     }  /* for */
    7894             :   }  /* if */
    7895             :   if (!found_copy_ctor &&
    7896             :       kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_has_nothrow_copy) {
    7897             :     /* If no copy constructor was found in the class, return the normal value
    7898             :        (which is independent of the declaration order of, e.g., constructors
    7899             :        in base classes). */
    7900             :     result = compute_has_nothrow_copy(type);
    7901             :   }  /* if */
    7902             :   return result;
    7903             : }  /* microsoft_has_copy_predicate */
    7904             : 
    7905             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7906             : 
    7907           0 : static a_boolean has_trivial_move_constructor(a_type_ptr  type)
