    8081             : 
    8082           0 : static a_boolean type_has_unique_object_representations(a_type_ptr type)
    8083             : /*
    8084             : Return TRUE if type satisfies the std::has_unique_object_representations
    8085             : trait as described in the C++17 Standard. If type is a class type, it must
    8086             : be complete and be trivially copyable.
    8087             : 
    8088             : The result of this predicate is largely left implementation-defined in the
    8089             : C++ Standard; the code below reflects the values for the Microsoft and g++
    8090             : compilers.  This function will need to be customized for ABIs and
    8091             : architectures for which these assumptions are not valid.
    8092             : */
    8093             : {
    8094           0 :   a_boolean  result = TRUE;
    8095           0 :   a_type_ptr orig_type = type;
    8096             : 
    8097           0 :   type = skip_typerefs(type);
    8098           0 :   if (is_immediate_class_type(type)) {
    8099           0 :     if (!is_trivially_copyable_type(type)) {
    8100             :       /* The result is false for a type that is not trivially copyable. */
    8101             :       result = FALSE;
    8102             :     } else {
    8103             :       /* A trivially-copyable class type has unique object representations
    8104             :          if all of its subobjects do and it has no padding bytes
    8105             :          anywhere. */
    8106           0 :       a_targ_size_t    end_of_last_subobject = 0;
    8107           0 :       unsigned int     bit_offset_of_end = 0;
    8108           0 :       a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    8109           0 :       a_field_ptr      field;
    8110           0 :       a_field_ptr      prev_field = NULL;
    8111           0 :       a_targ_size_t    prev_field_size = 0;
    8112             :       /* First check all direct base subobjects to see if they have unique
    8113             :          object representations and if there is any padding between
    8114             :          them. */
    8115           0 :       for (bcp = type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->base_classes;
    8116           0 :            result && bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    8117           0 :         if (bcp->direct) {
    8118           0 :           if (bcp->offset != end_of_last_subobject) {
    8119             :             /* There's padding between base class subobjects. */
    8120             :             result = FALSE;
    8121           0 :           } else if (bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list ==
    8122             :                                                                         NULL) {
    8123             :             /* An empty base class: treat it as having size 0 and do not
    8124             :                check type_has_unique_object_representation, since an empty
    8125             :                class will consist of nothing but padding.  If it was not
    8126             :                optimized as an empty base class, the offset checks below
    8127             :                will catch it and give a FALSE result. */
    8128             :           } else {
    8129           0 :             if (!type_has_unique_object_representations(bcp->type)) {
    8130           0 :               result = FALSE;
    8131             :             }  /* if */
    8132           0 :             end_of_last_subobject += bcp->type->size;
    8133             :           }  /* if */
    8134             :         }  /* if */
    8135             :       }  /* for */
    8136             :       /* Now check all nonstatic data members for the same. */
    8137           0 :       for (field = type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    8138           0 :            result && field != NULL; field = field->next) {
    8139           0 :         a_type_ptr field_type = skip_typerefs(field->type);
    8140           0 :         if (type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union && prev_field != NULL &&
    8141           0 :             field_type->size != prev_field_size) {
    8142             :           /* There will be padding in a union if not all fields are the
    8143             :              same size. */
    8144             :           result = FALSE;
    8145           0 :         } else if (field->offset != end_of_last_subobject ||
    8146           0 :             field->offset_bit_remainder != bit_offset_of_end) {
    8147             :           /* There's padding between nonstatic data members. */
    8148             :           result = FALSE;
    8149             :         } else {
    8150           0 :           if (!type_has_unique_object_representations(field_type)) {
    8151           0 :             result = FALSE;
    8152             :           }  /* if */
    8153           0 :           if (type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
    8154             :             /* Do not update end_of_last_subobject: each subobject begins
    8155             :                at offset 0. */
    8156           0 :             prev_field = field;
    8157           0 :             prev_field_size = field_type->size;
    8158           0 :           } else if (field->is_bit_field) {
    8159           0 :             bit_offset_of_end += field->bit_size;
    8160           0 :             end_of_last_subobject += bit_offset_of_end / targ_char_bit;
    8161           0 :             bit_offset_of_end %= targ_char_bit;
    8162             :           } else {
    8163           0 :             end_of_last_subobject += field_type->size;
    8164             :           }  /* if */
    8165             :         }  /* if */
    8166             :       }  /* for */
    8167             :       /* Finally, check for tail padding. */
    8168           0 :       if (type->kind != (a_type_kind)tk_union &&
    8169           0 :           end_of_last_subobject != type->size) {
    8170           0 :         result = FALSE;
    8171             :       }  /* if */
    8172             :     }  /* if */
    8173           0 :   } else if (gpp_mode && is_volatile_qualified_type(orig_type)) {
    8174             :     /* g++ treats volatile-qualified types as not having unique object
    8175             :        representations. */
    8176             :     result = FALSE;
    8177             :   } else {
    8178             :     /* A non-class type. */
    8179           0 :     switch (type->kind) {
    8180             :       /* Types with no padding and no non-canonical representations. */
    8181             :       case tk_error:
    8182             :       case tk_integer:
    8183             :       case tk_ptr_to_member:
    8184             :       case tk_template_param:
    8185             :         break;
    8186             :       /* Types with padding and/or non-canonical representations. */
    8187             : #if FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED
    8188           0 :       case tk_fixed_point:
    8189             : #endif /* FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED */
    8190             :       case tk_float:
    8191             : #if C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED
    8192             :       case tk_imaginary:
    8193             :       case tk_complex:
    8194             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
    8195             :       case tk_nullptr:
    8196           0 :         result = FALSE;
    8197           0 :         break;
    8198           0 :       case tk_void:
    8199             :         /* A void type has no fixed representation. */
    8200           0 :         result = FALSE;
    8201           0 :         break;
    8202           0 :       case tk_pointer:
    8203             :         /* Reference types are not object types. */
    8204           0 :         result = !type->variant.pointer.is_reference;
    8205           0 :         break;
    8206           0 :       default:
    8207             :         /* Non-object types, such as function types, should return
    8208             :            FALSE. */
    8209           0 :         result = FALSE;
    8210           0 :         break;
    8211             :     }  /* switch */
    8212             :   }  /* if */
    8213           0 :   return result;
    8214             : }  /* type_has_unique_object_representations */
    8215             : 
    8216             : 
    8217          51 : static void fold_unary_type_trait_helper(
    8218             :                                     an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    8219             :                                     a_constant_ptr     constant,
    8220             :                                     a_boolean          maintain_expression,
    8221             :                                     a_source_position  *pos,
    8222             :                                     a_boolean          complete_class_property)
    8223             : /*
    8224             : expr is an enk_builtin_operation node representing a boolean type predicate
    8225             : (as described in ISO/IEC 19768) with a single type operand (e.g.,
    8226             : "__is_union").  If the operand type is nondependent, store a boolean
    8227             : constant in *constant.  The boolean constant will have value "true" if the
    8228             : associated type predicate is true for the type represented by its operand.
    8229             : otherwise, the constant will have value "false".  If the operand type is
    8230             : dependent, store a ck_template_param constant in *constant.  The constant
    8231             : will be of the tpck_expression variant and will point to the given
    8232             : expression.  If maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the
    8233             : returned constant will be set as well.  If complete_class_property is TRUE
    8234             : and the operand type is an incomplete class type, the result will be FALSE
    8235             : and, if pos is not NULL, an error will be reported.
    8236             : */
    8237             : {
    8238          51 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands;
    8239          51 :   a_type_ptr        type;
    8240             : 
    8241             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear here, since the construct is generated. */
    8242          51 :   check_assertion(arg != NULL && arg->next == NULL && is_type_node(arg));
    8243          51 :   type = type_operand_type(arg);
    8244          51 :   if (is_template_dependent_type(type) ||
    8245             :       (microsoft_mode && in_ms_nonreal_class_instantiation())) {
    8246             :     /* For template-dependent types, create a ck_template_param result.
    8247             :        In Microsoft nonreal instantiations, we may end up with incomplete-but-
    8248             :        nondependent types but they shouldn't trigger an error; therefore, we
    8249             :        create a ck_template_param result for all types in such contexts. */
    8250           0 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_template_param);
    8251           0 :     set_template_param_constant_kind(
    8252             :                    constant, (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_expression);
    8253           0 :     constant->variant.template_param.variant.expr = expr;
    8254             :   } else {
    8255          51 :     a_boolean                 result = FALSE, incomplete_class_error = FALSE;
    8256          51 :     a_boolean                 is_list = FALSE;
    8257          51 :     a_builtin_operation_kind  kind = expr->variant.builtin_operation.kind;
    8258          51 :     a_symbol_ptr              sym = NULL;
    8259          51 :     a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
    8260          51 :                               cssp = NULL;
    8261          51 :     a_boolean                 is_const = is_const_qualified_type(type);
    8262          51 :     a_type_ptr                orig_type = type;
    8263          51 :     if (kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_trivial ||
    8264          51 :         kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_standard_layout ||
    8265          51 :         kind == (a_builtin_operation_kind)bok_is_literal_type ||

    8707             : 
    8708           0 : static void fold_types_compatible(an_expr_node_ptr   expr,
    8709             :                                   a_constant_ptr     constant,
    8710             :                                   a_boolean          maintain_expression)
    8711             : /*
    8712             : expr is an enk_builtin_operation node for a GNU C __builtin_types_compatible
    8713             : operation.  If the operand types are nondependent, store a boolean constant in
    8714             : *constant.  The boolean constant will have value "true" if the operand types
    8715             : are "compatible" (ignoring top-level qualifiers); otherwise, the constant will
    8716             : have value "false".  If either of the operand types is dependent, store a
    8717             : ck_template_param constant in *constant.  The constant will be of the
    8718             : tpck_expression variant and will point to the given expression.
    8719             : If maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the returned
    8720             : constant will be set as well.
    8721             : */
    8722             : {
    8723           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg1 = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands,
    8724           0 :                     arg2 = arg1->next;
    8725           0 :   a_type_ptr        type1, type2;
    8726             : 
    8727             :   /* eok_parens shouldn't appear here, since the construct is generated. */
    8728           0 :   check_assertion(arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL && arg2->next == NULL &&
    8729             :                   arg1->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_type_operand &&
    8730             :                   arg2->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_type_operand);

    8732           0 :   type2 = arg2->variant.type_operand.type;

    8759             : 
    8760         508 : void fold_builtin_operation_if_possible(
    8761             :                               an_expr_node_ptr             expr,
    8762             :                               a_constant_ptr               constant,
    8763             :                               a_boolean                    maintain_expression,
    8764             :                               a_source_position            *pos,
    8765             :                               a_boolean                    *not_a_constant)
    8766             : /*
    8767             : The given expression is a node of kind enk_builtin_operation.  If any of its
    8768             : operands are template-dependent, the result is not foldable and a
    8769             : ck_template_param constant (of the tpck_expression variant) is stored in
    8770             : *constant (*not_a_constant is set to FALSE in such cases).  Similarly, the
    8771             : result is not foldable if the operands are such that the result is not a
    8772             : constant (*not_a_constant is set to TRUE in those cases).  Otherwise, an
    8773             : attempt is made to fold the operation and *not_a_constant is set to FALSE.  If
    8774             : the folding is successful, the result is returned through *constant.  If the
    8775             : folding fails, an error constant is returned through *constant and if pos is
    8776             : non-NULL diagnostics are issued at the indicated position.
    8777             : If maintain_expression is TRUE, the backing expression for the returned
    8778             : constant is set as well.
    8779             : */
    8780             : {
    8781         508 :   a_boolean         has_error = FALSE;
    8782         508 :   an_expr_node_ptr  arg = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands;
    8783             : 
    8784             :   /* Most built-in operations result in constants.  So we start with that
    8785             :      assumption. */
    8786         508 :   *not_a_constant = FALSE;
    8787         508 :   check_assertion(expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_builtin_operation);
    8788             :   /* Check if an error was already encountered.  In that case, we silently
    8789             :      produce an error constant. */
    8790        1174 :   for (; arg != NULL; arg =  arg->next) {
    8791         666 :     if (arg->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_error) {
    8792             :       has_error = TRUE;
    8793             :       break;
    8794             :     }  /* if */
    8795             :   }  /* for */
    8796         508 :   if (has_error) {
    8797           0 :     clear_constant(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_error);
    8798         508 :   } else if (is_template_dependent_context() && !scope_stack_top().is_rescan) {
    8799             :     /* Unsubstituted parameters may make actual folding impossible.  Produce
    8800             :        a ck_template_param/tpck_expression entry instead. */
    8801         344 :     make_template_param_expr_constant(expr, constant);
    8802             :   } else {
    8803         164 :     switch (expr->variant.builtin_operation.kind) {
    8804           0 :       case bok_offsetof:
    8805           0 :         fold_offsetof(expr, constant, maintain_expression, pos,
    8806             :                       not_a_constant);

    8808             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

    8896             : 
    8897             : #if BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED
    8898             : 
    8899             : a_boolean is_foldable_gnu_builtin_function(a_routine_ptr rp,
    8900             :                                            a_boolean     *pseudo_call)
    8901             : /*
    8902             : Return TRUE if and only if the routine rp is a GNU-style built-in function
    8903             : and calls to that function might be valid constant-expressions.
    8904             : *pseudo_call is set to TRUE if the arguments to the built-in function call
    8905             : are not treated like standard call arguments (e.g., if they behave like
    8906             : sizeof arguments); otherwise, *pseudo_call is set to FALSE.
    8907             : pseudo_call can be NULL if that information is not needed.
    8908             : */
    8909             : {
    8910             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
    8911             : 
    8912             :   if (pseudo_call != NULL) *pseudo_call = FALSE;

    9001             : 
    9002             : 
    9003             : static
    9004             : a_boolean fold_bit_count_operation_if_possible(a_routine_ptr     rp,
    9005             :                                                an_expr_node_ptr  arg,
    9006             :                                                a_constant        *result_con)
    9007             : /*
    9008             : rp represents a GNU builtin bit counting function which is being applied to
    9009             : the given argument.  If the argument is a constant integer, set *result_con
    9010             : to the result of that count and return TRUE.  Otherwise, return FALSE.
    9011             : 
    9012             : The bit counting functions are (for "unsigned int" arguments):
    9013             :   ffs: index of the least-significant 1 (or zero if there is none)
    9014             :   clz: number of leading zeros
    9015             :   ctz: number of trailing zeros
    9016             :   popcount: number of ones
    9017             :   parity: number of ones modulo 2
    9018             : Variants for unsigned long (e.g., ffsl) and unsigned long long (e.g., ctzll)
    9019             : arguments are available in all cases.
    9020             : 
    9021             : This routine will fail to fold the operation (and hence return FALSE) if the
    9022             : argument cannot be represented in a_host_large_unsigned.
    9023             : */
    9024             : {
    9025             :   a_boolean   success = FALSE;
    9026             :   a_type_ptr  result_type;
    9027             : 
    9028             :   check_assertion(is_gnu_builtin_function(rp));
    9029             :   result_type = return_type_of(rp->type);
    9030             :   result_type = skip_typerefs(result_type);
    9031             :   check_assertion(result_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_integer);
    9032             :   if (is_constant_node(arg) && node_constant_is(arg, ck_integer)) {
    9033             :     a_constant_ptr         cp = node_constant(arg);
    9034             :     a_boolean              err;
    9035             :     a_host_large_unsigned  val = unsigned_value_of_integer_constant(cp, &err);
    9036             :     if (!err) {
    9037             :       a_targ_size_t  n_bits = skip_typerefs(cp->type)->size*targ_char_bit;
    9038             :       a_targ_size_t  k, result = 0;
    9039             :       /* Traverse the bits of the argument.  n_bits may be larger than the
    9040             :          number of bits in a_host_large_unsigned but that is not a problem:
    9041             :          The overflow case was avoided with the test for !err above and so
    9042             :          the excess bits can be assumed to be zeros. */
    9043             :       for (k = 0; k < n_bits; ++k, val >>= 1) {
    9044             :         a_boolean  bit = ((val & 1) != 0);
    9045             :         switch (rp->variant.builtin_function_kind) {
    9046             :           case bfk_ffs:
    9047             :           case bfk_ffsl:
    9048             : #if LONG_LONG_ALLOWED
    9049             :           case bfk_ffsll:
    9050             : #endif /* LONG_LONG_ALLOWED */
    9051             :             /* Index of the least significant 1-bit. */
    9052             :             if (bit) {
    9053             :               result = k+1;
    9054             :               goto count_done;
    9055             :             }  /* if */
    9056             :             break;
    9057             :           case bfk_clz:
    9058             :           case bfk_clzl:
    9059             : #if LONG_LONG_ALLOWED
    9060             :           case bfk_clzll:
    9061             : #endif /* LONG_LONG_ALLOWED */
    9062             :             /* Count of leading zeros. */
    9063             :             result = bit ? 0 : result+1;
    9064             :             break;
    9065             :           case bfk_ctz:
    9066             :           case bfk_ctzl:
    9067             : #if LONG_LONG_ALLOWED
    9068             :           case bfk_ctzll:
    9069             : #endif /* LONG_LONG_ALLOWED */
    9070             :             /* Count of trailing zeros. */
    9071             :             if (bit) {
    9072             :               goto count_done;
    9073             :             } else {
    9074             :               ++result;
    9075             :             }  /* if */
    9076             :             break;
    9077             :           case bfk_popcount:
    9078             :           case bfk_popcountl:
    9079             : #if LONG_LONG_ALLOWED
    9080             :           case bfk_popcountll:
    9081             : #endif /* LONG_LONG_ALLOWED */
    9082             :             /* Count of ones. */
    9083             :             if (bit) result += 1;
    9084             :             break;
    9085             :           case bfk_parity:
    9086             :           case bfk_parityl:
    9087             : #if LONG_LONG_ALLOWED
    9088             :           case bfk_parityll:
    9089             : #endif /* LONG_LONG_ALLOWED */
    9090             :             /* Count of ones. */
    9091             :             if (bit) result = (result+1) & 1;
    9092             :             break;
    9093             :           default:
    9094             :             unexpected_condition();
    9095             :         }  /* switch */
    9096             :       }  /* for */
    9097             : count_done:
    9098             :       set_unsigned_integer_constant(result_con, (a_host_large_unsigned)result,
    9099             :                                     result_type->variant.integer.int_kind);
    9100             :       success = TRUE;
    9101             :     }  /* if */
    9102             :   }  /* if */
    9103             :   return success;
    9104             : }  /* fold_bit_count_operation_if_possible */
    9105             : 
    9106             : #if TARG_HAS_IEEE_FLOATING_POINT
    9107             : 
    9108             : static a_boolean fold_fptest_if_possible(a_routine_ptr     rp,
    9109             :                                          an_expr_node_ptr  arg,
    9110             :                                          a_constant        *result_con)
    9111             : /*
    9112             : rp represents a GNU builtin floating-point test function (__builtin_isnan or
    9113             : __builtin_isinf) which is being applied to the given argument.  If the argument
    9114             : is a constant, set *result_con to the result of the test and return TRUE.
    9115             : Otherwise, return FALSE.
    9116             : */
    9117             : {
    9118             :   a_boolean   success = FALSE, unknown_result = FALSE;
    9119             :   a_type_ptr  result_type;
    9120             : 
    9121             :   check_assertion(is_gnu_builtin_function(rp));
    9122             :   result_type = return_type_of(rp->type);
    9123             :   result_type = skip_typerefs(result_type);
    9124             :   check_assertion(result_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_integer);
    9125             :   if (is_constant_node(arg) && node_constant_is(arg, ck_float)) {
    9126             :     a_constant_ptr         cp = node_constant(arg);
    9127             :     a_host_large_unsigned  result = 0;
    9128             :     switch (rp->variant.builtin_function_kind) {
    9129             :       case bfk_isnan:
    9130             :       case bfk_isnanf:
    9131             :       case bfk_isnanl:
    9132             :         result = fp_is_nan(&cp->variant.float_value,
    9133             :                            cp->type->variant.float_kind);
    9134             :         break;
    9135             :       case bfk_isinf:
    9136             :       case bfk_isinff:
    9137             :       case bfk_isinfl:
    9138             :         result = fp_is_infinity(&cp->variant.float_value,
    9139             :                                 cp->type->variant.float_kind);
    9140             :         break;
    9141             :       case bfk_isfinite:
    9142             :         result = !fp_is_infinity(&cp->variant.float_value,
    9143             :                                  cp->type->variant.float_kind) &&
    9144             :                  !fp_is_nan(&cp->variant.float_value,
    9145             :                             cp->type->variant.float_kind);
    9146             :         break;
    9147             :       case bfk_isnormal:
    9148             :         result = fp_is_normalized(&cp->variant.float_value,
    9149             :                                   cp->type->variant.float_kind,
    9150             :                                   &unknown_result);
    9151             :         break;
    9152             :       case bfk_signbit:
    9153             :       case bfk_signbitf:
    9154             :       case bfk_signbitl:
    9155             :         if (fp_is_nan(&cp->variant.float_value,
    9156             :                       cp->type->variant.float_kind)) {
    9157             :           /* We don't currently attempt to determine the sign bit of a NaN
    9158             :              value.  (This matches Clang but not GCC.) */
    9159             :           unknown_result = TRUE;
    9160             :         } else {
    9161             :           result = fp_signbit(cp->type->variant.float_kind,
    9162             :                               &cp->variant.float_value);
    9163             :         }  /* if */
    9164             :         break;
    9165             :       default:
    9166             :         unexpected_condition();
    9167             :     }  /* switch */
    9168             :     if (!unknown_result) {
    9169             :       set_integer_constant(result_con, (a_host_large_integer)result,
    9170             :                            result_type->variant.integer.int_kind);
    9171             :       success = TRUE;
    9172             :     }  /* if */
    9173             :   }  /* if */
    9174             :   return success;
    9175             : }  /* fold_fptest_if_possible */
    9176             : 
    9177             : 
    9178             : static a_boolean is_empty_string_literal(a_constant_ptr  cp)
    9179             : /*
    9180             : Return TRUE if the given constant is the empty string literal ("") or the
    9181             : address thereof.
    9182             : */
    9183             : {
    9184             :   a_boolean  result;
    9185             : 
    9186             :   if (cp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
    9187             :       cp->variant.address.kind == (an_address_base_kind)abk_constant &&
    9188             :       cp->variant.address.offset == 0) {
    9189             :     cp = cp->variant.address.variant.constant;
    9190             :   }  /* if */
    9191             :   if (cp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string &&
    9192             :       cp->variant.string.length == 1 &&
    9193             :       cp->variant.string.value[0] == '\0') {
    9194             :     result = TRUE;
    9195             :   } else {
    9196             :     result = FALSE;
    9197             :   }  /* if */
    9198             :   return result;
    9199             : }  /* is_empty_string_literal */
    9200             : 
    9201             : #endif /* TARG_HAS_IEEE_FLOATING_POINT */
    9202             : 
    9203             : static a_boolean fold_pow_if_possible(a_constant_ptr  base,
    9204             :                                       a_constant_ptr  exp,
    9205             :                                       a_constant_ptr  result,
    9206             :                                       a_type_ptr      result_type)
    9207             : /*
    9208             : base and exp are floating-point constants.  If exp represents a small
    9209             : nonnegative integer value, store the value of base raised to the power
    9210             : indicated by exp in result and return TRUE (the final result is a
    9211             : floating-point value of the given type).  Otherwise, return FALSE.
    9212             : */
    9213             : {
    9214             :   a_boolean   folded = FALSE, err = FALSE, mode_dep;
    9215             :   a_host_large_integer
    9216             :               e;
    9217             :   an_internal_float_value
    9218             :               b, acc, v;
    9219             :   a_type_ptr  exp_type = skip_typerefs(exp->type),
    9220             :               base_type = skip_typerefs(base->type);
    9221             :   
    9222             :   check_assertion(base->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_float &&
    9223             :                   is_real_floating_type(base_type) &&
    9224             :                   exp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_float &&
    9225             :                   is_real_floating_type(exp_type) &&
    9226             :                   is_real_floating_type(result_type));
    9227             :   /* First check whether exp represents a small integer. */
    9228             :   fp_to_host_large_integer(exp_type->variant.float_kind,
    9229             :                            &exp->variant.float_value, &e, &err, &mode_dep);
    9230             :   if (!err && e >= 0 && e < 256) {
    9231             :     /* Check whether exp represents an integer by converting e back to a
    9232             :        floating-point value a testing if it remains unmodified. */
    9233             :     fp_host_large_integer_to_float(exp_type->variant.float_kind, e, &v, &err);
    9234             :     if (fp_compare(exp_type->variant.float_kind,
    9235             :                    &exp->variant.float_value, &v, &err) == 0 && !err) {
    9236             :       folded = TRUE;
    9237             :     }  /* if */
    9238             :   }  /* if */
    9239             :   if (folded) {
    9240             :     /* The actual computation will be done with "long double" precision. */
    9241             :     fp_change_kind(&base->variant.float_value, base_type->variant.float_kind,
    9242             :                    &b, (a_float_kind)fk_long_double,
    9243             :                    &err, &mode_dep);
    9244             :     if (err) folded = FALSE;
    9245             :   }  /* if */
    9246             :   if (folded) {
    9247             :     fp_host_large_integer_to_float((a_float_kind)fk_long_double,
    9248             :                                    (a_host_large_integer)1, &acc, &err);
    9249             :     check_assertion(!err);
    9250             :     /* The initial value b0 of b is the "base" value.  It is subsequently
    9251             :        squared to compute powers b1 = b0^2, b2 = b1^2 = b0^4, etc.  Every
    9252             :        time bit n is set in e (n = 0 for the least significant bit), an
    9253             :        accumulator (starting with value 1) is multiplied by bn =  b0^(2^n). */
    9254             :     while (e != 0) {
    9255             :       if (e & 1) {
    9256             :         /* Update the accumulator. */
    9257             :         fp_multiply((a_float_kind)fk_long_double,
    9258             :                     &b, &acc, &acc, &err, &mode_dep);
    9259             :         if (err) {
    9260             :           folded = FALSE;
    9261             :           break;
    9262             :         }  /* if */
    9263             :       }  /* if */
    9264             :       e = e/2;
    9265             :       if (e != 0) {
    9266             :         /* Compute the next value of b: b <- b*b. */
    9267             :         fp_multiply((a_float_kind)fk_long_double, &b, &b, &b, &err, &mode_dep);
    9268             :         if (err) {
    9269             :           folded = FALSE;
    9270             :           break;
    9271             :         }  /* if */
    9272             :       }  /* if */
    9273             :     }  /* while */
    9274             :     if (folded) {
    9275             :       /* Store the final result with the required precision. */
    9276             :       clear_constant(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_float);
    9277             :       result->type = result_type;
    9278             :       fp_change_kind(&acc, (a_float_kind)fk_long_double,
    9279             :                      &result->variant.float_value,
    9280             :                      skip_typerefs(result_type)->variant.float_kind,
    9281             :                      &err, &mode_dep);
    9282             :       folded = !err;
    9283             :     }  /* if */
    9284             :   }  /* if */
    9285             :   return folded;
    9286             : }  /* fold_pow_if_possible */
    9287             : 
    9288             : 
    9289             : static a_boolean fold_lock_free_query_if_possible(
    9290             :                                          a_builtin_function_kind  bfk,
    9291             :                                          an_expr_node_ptr         size_arg,
    9292             :                                          an_expr_node_ptr         ptr_arg,
    9293             :                                          a_constant_ptr           result,
    9294             :                                          a_type_ptr               result_type)
    9295             : /*
    9296             : bfk is either bfk_atomic_always_lock_free or bfk_atomic_is_lock_free.
    9297             : If possible, fold a call to the corresponding "built-in functions" with the
    9298             : given arguments, and return the result in *result.  If successful, return
    9299             : TRUE.
    9300             : */
    9301             : {
    9302             :   a_boolean  folded = FALSE, err;
    9303             : 
    9304             :   if (is_constant_node(size_arg) && node_constant_is(size_arg, ck_integer)) {
    9305             :     /* These queries can only be folded if the first argument is a
    9306             :        constant. */
    9307             :     a_constant_ptr         size_con = node_constant(size_arg);
    9308             :     a_host_large_unsigned  size;
    9309             :     a_boolean              size_8_foldable = FALSE;
    9310             :     if (bfk == (a_builtin_function_kind)bfk_atomic_always_lock_free ||
    9311             :         is_constant_node(ptr_arg)) {
    9312             :       /* For __atomic_is_lock_free, GCC appears to always fold the cases where
    9313             :          the size argument is 1, 2, or 4.  The case where it is 8, is only
    9314             :          folded if ptr_arg represents an address constant expression or a
    9315             :          null pointer constant. */
    9316             :       size_8_foldable = TRUE;
    9317             :     }  /* if */
    9318             :     size = unsigned_value_of_integer_constant(size_con, &err);
    9319             :     if (size == 1 || size == 2 || size == 4 ||
    9320             :         (size == 8 && size_8_foldable)) {
    9321             :       set_unsigned_integer_constant(result, (a_host_large_unsigned)1,
    9322             :                                     result_type->variant.integer.int_kind);
    9323             :       folded = TRUE;
    9324             :     } else if (bfk == (a_builtin_function_kind)bfk_atomic_always_lock_free) {
    9325             :       set_unsigned_integer_constant(result, (a_host_large_unsigned)0,
    9326             :                                     result_type->variant.integer.int_kind);
    9327             :       folded = TRUE;
    9328             :     }  /* if */
    9329             :   }  /* if */
    9330             :   return folded;
    9331             : }  /* fold_lock_free_query_if_possible */
    9332             : 
    9333             : 
    9334             : static a_boolean is_dependent_list_of_constant_nodes(an_expr_node_ptr  list)
    9335             : /*
    9336             : Return TRUE if every node in the given list is a constant, and at least one is
    9337             : either a ck_template_param constant or has a template-dependent type.
    9338             : */
    9339             : {
    9340             :   a_boolean        is_constant = TRUE, is_dependent = FALSE;
    9341             :   an_expr_node_ptr node;
    9342             : 
    9343             :   for (node = list; node != NULL; node = node->next) {
    9344             :     an_expr_node_ptr expr = skip_parens(node);
    9345             :     if (!is_constant_node(expr)) {
    9346             :       is_constant = FALSE;
    9347             :       break;
    9348             :     } else if (expr_is_instantiation_dependent(expr)) {
    9349             :       is_dependent = TRUE;
    9350             :     }  /* if */
    9351             :   }  /* for */
    9352             :   return is_constant && is_dependent;
    9353             : }  /* is_dependent_list_of_constant_nodes */
    9354             : 
    9355             : 
    9356             : a_boolean fold_gnu_builtin_function_call_if_possible(
    9357             :                                                   a_routine_ptr    rp,
    9358             :                                                   an_expr_node_ptr args,
    9359             :                                                   an_expr_node_ptr call_expr,
    9360             :                                                   a_constant       *result_con,
    9361             :                                                   an_error_code    *err_code)
    9362             : /*
    9363             : If "rp" is a GNU builtin function, see whether a call of
    9364             : "rp" with the argument list "args" can be folded to a constant.
    9365             : If so, set *result_con to the constant result and return TRUE.
    9366             : Otherwise, return FALSE.  If there's an error, set *err_code to the
    9367             : error code and return FALSE.  Otherwise, *err_code is set to
    9368             : ec_no_error.  call_expr is the original call node, which may be
    9369             : used to create a ck_template_param result for a dependent case.
    9370             : Note that in some cases, the builtin function is never folded;
    9371             : the folding mechanism is used as a way to validate argument values.
    9372             : */
    9373             : {
    9374             :   a_boolean      folded = FALSE;
    9375             :   a_constant_ptr result = local_constant();
    9376             : 
    9377             :   *err_code = ec_no_error;
    9378             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    9379             :   if (rp->implicit_alias) {
    9380             :     /* A call to a user-defined routine that is implicitly assumed equivalent
    9381             :        to a built-in function (recorded in
    9382             :        rp->gnu_extra_info->aliased_routine). */
    9383             :     rp = gnu_routine_supp(rp)->aliased_routine;
    9384             :   }  /* if */
    9385             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9386             :   if (is_gnu_builtin_function(rp)) {
    9387             :     a_type_ptr       result_type = f_skip_typerefs(return_type_of(rp->type));
    9388             :     an_expr_node_ptr args2 = NULL;
    9389             :     if (args != NULL) {
    9390             :       args2 = args->next;
    9391             :       args = skip_parens(args);
    9392             :     }  /* if */
    9393             :     switch (rp->variant.builtin_function_kind) {
    9394             :       case bfk_classify_type:
    9395             :         /* Pseudo-calls to this function should have been scanned and
    9396             :            folded in scan_gnu_builtin_pseudo_call. */
    9397             :         unexpected_condition();
    9398             :         break;
    9399             :       case bfk_constant_p:
    9400             :         /* Usually folded in scan_gnu_builtin_pseudo_call, but for
    9401             :            folding of constexpr calls we can get here. */
    9402             :         check_assertion(is_integral_type(result_type) && args != NULL);
    9403             :         set_integer_constant(result,
    9404             :                              (a_host_large_integer)is_constant_node(args),
    9405             :                              result_type->variant.integer.int_kind);
    9406             :         folded = TRUE;
    9407             :         break;
    9408             :       case bfk_huge_valf:
    9409             :       case bfk_huge_val:
    9410             :       case bfk_huge_vall:
    9411             :         /* A "huge" floating-point value.  (I.e., positive Infinity if
    9412             :            that is available, or the largest possible value of the
    9413             :            associated floating-point type.) */
    9414             :         if (args == NULL && is_floating_type(result_type)) {
    9415             :           clear_constant(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_float);
    9416             :           result->type = result_type;
    9417             :           folded = make_huge_fp_val(&result->variant.float_value,
    9418             :                                     result_type->variant.float_kind);
    9419             :         }  /* if */
    9420             :         break;
    9421             : #if TARG_HAS_IEEE_FLOATING_POINT
    9422             :       case bfk_nansf:
    9423             :       case bfk_nans:
    9424             :       case bfk_nansl:
    9425             :       case bfk_nanf:
    9426             :       case bfk_nan:
    9427             :       case bfk_nanl:
    9428             :         /* A signaling or non-signaling (i.e., "quiet") Not-a-Number value. */
    9429             :         { a_constant_ptr scon;
    9430             :           a_boolean      err = FALSE;
    9431             :           unsigned long  mantissa = 0;
    9432             :           if (args != NULL && args2 == NULL &&
    9433             :               expr_is_pointer_to_string_literal(args, &scon) &&
    9434             :               is_floating_type(result_type)) {
    9435             :             a_builtin_function_kind kind = rp->variant.builtin_function_kind;
    9436             :             a_boolean               signaling = FALSE;
    9437             :             if (kind == (a_builtin_function_kind)bfk_nansf ||
    9438             :                 kind == (a_builtin_function_kind)bfk_nans ||
    9439             :                 kind == (a_builtin_function_kind)bfk_nansl) {
    9440             :               signaling = TRUE;
    9441             :             }  /* if */
    9442             :             clear_constant(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_float);
    9443             :             result->type = result_type;
    9444             :             if (!is_empty_string_literal(scon)) {
    9445             :               /* The string specifies the bits that should be used in the
    9446             :                  mantissa portion of the NaN. */
    9447             :               mantissa = strtoul_interface(scon->variant.string.value, &err);
    9448             :             }  /* if */
    9449             :             if (!err) {
    9450             :               folded = make_fp_nan(&result->variant.float_value,
    9451             :                                    result_type->variant.float_kind,
    9452             :                                    signaling, mantissa);
    9453             :             }  /* if */
    9454             :           }  /* if */
    9455             :         }
    9456             :         break;
    9457             :       case bfk_inff:
    9458             :       case bfk_inf:
    9459             :       case bfk_infl:
    9460             :         /* A positive infinity value. */
    9461             :         if (args == NULL && is_floating_type(result_type)) {
    9462             :           clear_constant(result, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_float);
    9463             :           result->type = result_type;
    9464             :           folded = make_fp_infinity(&result->variant.float_value,
    9465             :                                     result_type->variant.float_kind);
    9466             :         }  /* if */
    9467             :         break;
    9468             : #endif /* TARG_HAS_IEEE_FLOATING_POINT */
    9469             :       case bfk_ffs:
    9470             :       case bfk_ffsl:
    9471             :       case bfk_clz:
    9472             :       case bfk_clzl:
    9473             :       case bfk_ctz:
    9474             :       case bfk_ctzl:
    9475             :       case bfk_popcount:
    9476             :       case bfk_popcountl:
    9477             :       case bfk_parity:
    9478             :       case bfk_parityl:
    9479             : #if LONG_LONG_ALLOWED
    9480             :       case bfk_ffsll:
    9481             :       case bfk_clzll:
    9482             :       case bfk_ctzll:
    9483             :       case bfk_popcountll:
    9484             :       case bfk_parityll:
    9485             : #endif /* LONG_LONG_ALLOWED */
    9486             :         /* Bit counting functions. */
    9487             :         if (args != NULL && args2 == NULL) {
    9488             :           folded = fold_bit_count_operation_if_possible(rp, args, result);
    9489             :         }  /* if */
    9490             :         break;
    9491             : #if TARG_HAS_IEEE_FLOATING_POINT
    9492             :       case bfk_isnan:
    9493             :       case bfk_isnanf:
    9494             :       case bfk_isnanl:
    9495             :       case bfk_isinf:
    9496             :       case bfk_isinff:
    9497             :       case bfk_isinfl:
    9498             :       case bfk_isfinite:
    9499             :       case bfk_isnormal:
    9500             :       case bfk_signbit:
    9501             :       case bfk_signbitf:
    9502             :       case bfk_signbitl:
    9503             :         /* Unlike some other functions handled here, __builtin_isnan and
    9504             :            __builtin_isinf are ellipsis functions, and hence ordinary call
    9505             :            processing will not diagnose invalid arguments.  GCC, however,
    9506             :            does check that there is exactly one argument of a real floating-
    9507             :            point type. */
    9508             :         if (args == NULL || args2 != NULL) {
    9509             :           *err_code = ec_call_requires_one_argument;
    9510             :         } else if (!is_real_floating_type(args->type) &&
    9511             :                    !is_template_param_type(args->type)) {
    9512             :           *err_code = ec_call_requires_floating_point_argument;
    9513             :         } else {
    9514             :           folded = fold_fptest_if_possible(rp, args, result);
    9515             :         }  /* if */
    9516             :         break;
    9517             : #endif /* TARG_HAS_IEEE_FLOATING_POINT */
    9518             :       case bfk_fpclassify:
    9519             :         /* We currently never fold calls to __builtin_fpclassify, but we do
    9520             :            check that the last argument has a floating-point type. */
    9521             :         { an_expr_node_ptr   arg = args;
    9522             :           unsigned long      n = 0;
    9523             :           for (; arg != NULL; n += 1, arg = arg->next) {
    9524             :             if (is_error_type(arg->type)) break;
    9525             :           }  /* for */
    9526             :           if (arg != NULL || n < 5) {
    9527             :             /* The routine type of __builtin_fpclassify is
    9528             :                  int (int, int, int, int, int, ...);
    9529             :                So if we have less than five arguments, an error should be
    9530             :                issued elsewhere.  If we ran into an error type, no other error
    9531             :                should be emitted either. */
    9532             :           } else if (n == 5 || n > 6) {
    9533             :             /* Five arguments or more than six: Issue an error. */
    9534             :             *err_code = ec_invalid_builtin_fpclassify_args;
    9535             :           } else {
    9536             :             /* Check that the last (sixth) argument has floating-point type. */
    9537             :             an_expr_node_ptr  fparg = args2->next->next->next->next;
    9538             :             if (!is_real_floating_type(fparg->type) &&
    9539             :                 !is_template_param_type(fparg->type)) {
    9540             :               if (!is_error_type(fparg->type)) {
    9541             :                 *err_code = ec_bad_final_builtin_fpclassify_arg;
    9542             :               }  /* if */
    9543             :             }  /* if */
    9544             :           }  /* if */
    9545             :         }
    9546             :         break;
    9547             :       case bfk_strlen:
    9548             :         /* strlen of a constant string can be folded in C mode. */
    9549             :         { a_constant_ptr scon;
    9550             :           if (C_mode() && args != NULL && args2 == NULL &&
    9551             :               expr_is_pointer_to_string_literal(args, &scon) &&
    9552             :               is_normal_character_kind(scon->character_kind) &&
    9553             :               is_integral_type(result_type)) {
    9554             :             a_targ_size_t len;
    9555             :             check_assertion(scon->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string);
    9556             :             /* Watch out for strings that don't have a terminating null. */
    9557             :             for (len = 0; len < scon->variant.string.length; len++) {
    9558             :               if (scon->variant.string.value[len] == '\0') {
    9559             :                 /* Found first null character, so we know the length. */
    9560             :                 folded = TRUE;
    9561             :                 set_integer_constant(result,
    9562             :                                      (a_host_large_integer)len,
    9563             :                                      skip_typerefs(result_type)->
    9564             :                                                      variant.integer.int_kind);
    9565             :                 break;
    9566             :               }  /* if */
    9567             :             }  /* for */
    9568             :           }  /* if */
    9569             :         }
    9570             :         break;
    9571             :       case bfk_abs:
    9572             :         /* abs of a constant integer can be folded. */
    9573             :         { a_constant_ptr con;
    9574             :           if (args != NULL && args2 == NULL &&
    9575             :               is_constant_node(args) &&
    9576             :               constant_is((con = node_constant(args)), ck_integer) &&
    9577             :               is_integral_type(con->type) &&
    9578             :               is_integral_type(result_type)) {
    9579             :             a_boolean err = FALSE;
    9580             :             copy_constant(con, result);
    9581             :             /* Probably no type difference between the parameter type and
    9582             :                the result type, but change it just in case. */
    9583             :             result->type = result_type;
    9584             :             if (sign_of_integer_constant(con) < 0) {
    9585             :               /* Negate a negative value. */
    9586             :               negate_integer_value(&result->variant.integer_value, &err);
    9587             :               if (!err &&
    9588             :                   !in_range_for_integer_kind(result, result,
    9589             :                       skip_typerefs(result->type)->variant.integer.int_kind)) {
    9590             :                 err = TRUE;
    9591             :               }  /* if */
    9592             :             }  /* if */
    9593             :             if (!err) folded = TRUE;
    9594             :           }  /* if */
    9595             :         }
    9596             :         break;
    9597             :       case bfk_fabs:
    9598             :       case bfk_fabsf:
    9599             :       case bfk_fabsl:
    9600             :         /* abs of a constant float can be folded. */
    9601             :         { a_constant_ptr con;
    9602             :           if (args != NULL && args2 == NULL &&

    9639             :               /* GCC folds only certain combinations of values.  E.g., if the
    9640             :                  base is not an integer, it would appear that only raising to
    9641             :                  the power of -1, 0, 1, 2, and 3 is folded.  If the base is a
    9642             :                  power of 2, many more powers are folded.  The call to
    9643             :                  fold_pow_if_possible folds a different set of combinations,
    9644             :                  but the cases somewhat likely to show up in real code should

    9792         131 : a_constant_ptr constant_value_at_address(a_constant_ptr  addr_con,

   10036             :                    derived class object can be different from the order in
